original: rnam pa thams cad du ngag rtsub po'i tshig gis mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba nyid dang / legs par smra ba nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa dang / sman sbyin pa dang nad pa'i nye gnas dang / kun dga' ra ba'i gnas la sogs pa byed du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ngag rtsub po'i tshig gis mi smod pa dang / snyan par smra ba nyid dang / legs par smra ba nyid kyis rjes su mthun pa dang / sman sbyin pa dang nad pa'i nye gnas dang / kun dga' ra ba'i gnas la sogs pa byed du 'jug pa dang /
translated: They never criticize others with harsh words, and they are agreeable with their sweet and gentle speech. They give medicine and care for the sick, and they build parks and so forth.

original: gnas gzhi la sogs pa rnams @202b la lhag par rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'jam po la sogs par smra ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can rnams dam pa'i chos rnam par shes par byed pa dang / ngag 'khyal pa spangs pas skye bo thams cad rin po che la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: gnas gzhi la sogs pa rnams @202b la lhag par rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'jam po la sogs par smra ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can rnams dam pa'i chos rnam par shes par byed pa dang / ngag 'khyal pa spangs pas skye bo thams cad rin po che la sogs pa dang /
translated: They give away their homes and so forth, and they speak gently and so on. They make the beings of all the worlds understand the sacred Dharma, and they give up idle talk.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang bden par smra ba nyid dang / phra ma'i tshig la sogs pa med pa dang / sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du blta ba dang / khong khro ba la sogs pas dben par ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang bden par smra ba nyid dang / phra ma'i tshig la sogs pa med pa dang / sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du blta ba dang / khong khro ba la sogs pas dben par ston pa dang /
translated: Pure livelihood, speaking the truth, not speaking divisive words and so on, viewing all sentient beings as one's only child and being free of anger and so on are taught.

original: byin pa ae n+ya ya 'dra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: byin pa ae n+ya ya 'dra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The causes of the twenty two marks such as the crown protrusion are respectively the twenty two perfections.

translated: His body hairs are uniform, his nails have the color of copper, they are glossy, his nails are elevated, his nails are round, his fingers are tapered, his veins do not protrude,üîΩand his ankles do not protrude.

translated: His ankles do not protrude. His feet are even. He walks with the gait of a lion. He walks with the gait of an elephant. He walks with the gait of a swan.

translated: He walks with the gait of a bull. He walks turning to the right. He walks beautifully. His body is not crooked. His body is not bent. His body is well-proportioned. His body is clean. His body is smooth. His body is pure. His body is complete with the major marks. His body is expansive and beautiful. His steps are even.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i sku mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po dang / rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gser gyi kha dog la sogs pa'i sku mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
translated: The Tathagata is the lord of the wish-fulfilling jewel that is the nonconceptual mind, and one sees the body of the Tathagata, golden in color, etc., in accordance with one's own aspiration.

original: mtshan dang po 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mtshan dang po 'di rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang yod mod kyi /
translated: These first two marks are indeed possessed by bodhisattvas and by universal emperors,

original: cung zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang rdzogs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: cung zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang rdzogs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'o //
translated: but they are unsurpassed in the domain of the tathagatas, who possess them in a way that is enduring, clear, and complete.

original: sprul pa ni sprul pa ste des na sprul pa'i sku de ni mya ngan las 'da' zhing thams cad nas thams cad du nam mkha' ji srid bar dus ji lta ba dang bsam pa ji lta bar mtha' dag gi mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa

translated: The emanation body is emanation, and thus it is the emanation body that passes into nirvana, and that, in all ways and at all times, for as long as space remains, in accordance with the aspirations of beings and in accordance with the situation,

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'i sprul pa'i las rnams la sh'a kya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i skur sprul byed do zhes pa ni sprul pa yang yin la sku yang yin pas sprul pa'i sku ste /üîΩde'i dbang du byas nas bstan @204a * //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'i sprul pa'i las rnams la sh'a kya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i skur sprul byed do zhes pa ni sprul pa yang yin la sku yang yin pas sprul pa'i sku ste / de'i dbang du byas nas bstan @204a * //
translated: The emanation body is emanation and also a body, since it emanates the body of Shakyamuni, the Tathagata, and so on, in the activity of perfect accomplishment.

original: bcos las / gang gis srid pa ji srid par //
analyzed: bcos las / gang gis srid pa ji srid par //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:üîΩThe body that simultaneously

original: 'gro la phan pa sna tshogs dag / mnyam du mdzad pa'i sku de ni //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa sna tshogs dag / mnyam du mdzad pa'i sku de ni //
translated: performs various benefits for transmigrating beingsüîΩfor as long as the world exists

original: thub pa'i sprul sku rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: thub pa'i sprul sku rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: is the Sage's uninterrupted emanation body.

original: de bzhin las kyang rgyun mi 'chad //
analyzed: de bzhin las kyang rgyun mi 'chad //
translated: Likewise, its activity is uninterrupted.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba yin par 'dod //
translated: This is asserted to be cyclic existence.

original: ces te / de ltar sems can mnyam po la mi mnyam par so sor snang ba ni sems can rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: ces te / de ltar sems can mnyam po la mi mnyam par so sor snang ba ni sems can rnams kyi bdag po'i dbang gis te /
translated: Thus, the appearance of the same sentient beings as different is due to the power of sentient beings themselves.

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is stated in the following:

original: chos thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: All phenomena...

original: ji srid du chu dang / thang dang bar snang la rgyu ba'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi lus ngag gis kun du bsdus pas ni chos rnams la sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa nyid ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: ji srid du chu dang / thang dang bar snang la rgyu ba'i brtan pa dang g-yo ba rnams kyi lus ngag gis kun du bsdus pas ni chos rnams la sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa nyid ni chos thams cad de /
translated: As long as the bodies and speech of the stable and the moving, who move in the water, on the land, and in the sky, are included, the Blessed One's emanations in infinite world systems are all phenomena, for the purpose of training sentient beings in the Dharma.

original: de rnams mu med pa nyid pas bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mu med pa ste des sprul pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams mu med pa nyid pas bcom ldan 'das kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mu med pa ste des sprul pa nyid do //
translated: Since those are infinite, the Blessed One's perfection of wisdom is infinite, and by that, they are emanations.

original: stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar sprul pa'i sku rnams mtha' yas pa de ltar de rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyang mtha' yas pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar sprul pa'i sku rnams mtha' yas pa de ltar de rnams kyi stong pa nyid kyang mtha' yas pa nyid do //
translated: The line emptiness, etc. means that just as the emanation bodies are infinite, so too their emptiness is infinite.

original: gang gi stong pa nyid na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rgyud pa'i blo rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gang gi stong pa nyid na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rgyud pa'i blo rnams kyis te /
translated: The emptiness of what? Of the minds and mental factors that are the nature of the continuum of awareness.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin te /
translated: They are like illusory persons.

original: mu med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mu med pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: ji ltar de rnams kyi lus dang ngag sprul pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ji ltar sprul par ma gyur na /
analyzed: ji ltar de rnams kyi lus dang ngag sprul pa de bzhin du sems dang sems las byung ba yang ji ltar sprul par ma gyur na /
translated: Just as they emanate bodies and speech, so too they emanate minds and mental factors.

original: de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, they would not have the cause of appropriating them.

original: snga na med pa'i sems can rnams 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i sems can rnams 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings who did not exist previously would not arise.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes gsungs pa ni bden par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul pa'i sbyor ba'i thabs kyi las can zhes gsungs pa ni bden par 'dod de /
translated: But it is said that the buddhas have the function of emanating bodies, speech, and minds.

original: 'on kyang bden pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bden pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can te /
translated: This is accepted as true, but they have the cause of appropriating the truth.

original: lha'i byin gyis brlabs nas rmi lam mthong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: lha'i byin gyis brlabs nas rmi lam mthong ba bzhin te /
translated: It is like seeing a dream through the blessing of a god.

original: ngag gi don shes par byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ngag gi don shes par byed pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like understanding the meaning of speech.

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sems zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa rnams la rnam par gzigs nas sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams la chos ston par byed de /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa rnams la rnam par gzigs nas sprul pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams la chos ston par byed de /
translated: Having seen the conduct of the infinite sentient beings in the various world systems, the Blessed One teaches the Dharma to them by means of various emanations.

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sems kyi spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe conduct of the mind‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can de rnams kyis ji ltar nye bar bstan pa'i chos la kun du @204b dmigs par byed pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos skye bar gyur nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu spong bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyis ji ltar nye bar bstan pa'i chos la kun du @204b dmigs par byed pa'i gnyen po dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos skye bar gyur nas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mi dge ba'i chos rnams rab tu spong bar byed de /
translated: When the virtuous dharmas endowed with the antidote that thoroughly focuses on the Dharma as taught by those sentient beings arise, they abandon the non-virtuous dharmas that are their opposites.

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dge ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe virtuous‚Äù and so on.

original: sprul pa nyid ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ste /
analyzed: sprul pa nyid ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku ste /
translated: The emanation itself is the body of the Blessed One.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i rnam pa ni de'i skur 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i rnam pa ni de'i skur 'gyur ba med do //
translated: The illusory forms such as the illusory elephant emanated by the magician do not become his body.

original: rang gi lus nyid du byin gyis brlabs shing sprul nas rang gi lus bzhin du 'gro ba dang / tha snyad la sogs pa dang dka' spyad rnams su rnam par spros pa de'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus nyid du byin gyis brlabs shing sprul nas rang gi lus bzhin du 'gro ba dang / tha snyad la sogs pa dang dka' spyad rnams su rnam par spros pa de'i bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The Bhagavat‚Äôs body that is emanated in the various elaborations of conventional expressions, etc., and in the austerities is the Emanation Body.

original: de la sku gsum po 'di rnams kyang ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la sku gsum po 'di rnams kyang ni rtag pa ste /
translated: And these three Bodies are also permanent.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pas rtag pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin gyis rtag pas rtag pa ste /
translated: The Essential Body is permanent by its very nature, because it is eternal.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has no beginning and no end.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni de rten pas rtag pas rtag pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni de rten pas rtag pas rtag pa ste /
translated: The Complete Enjoyment Body is permanent by its support, because it is eternal.

original: thog ma 'dod kyang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma 'dod kyang tha ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has no beginning, but it does have an end.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshogs kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i chos kyi tshogs kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, the collection of dharmas such as the elements leading to enlightenment are also like that.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun rtag pa ste rtag tu 'byung zhing nub pa dang / nub nas yang nas yang du yul tha dad par rtag tu 'jug pas na de ltar mdzad pa yang rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni rgyun rtag pa ste rtag tu 'byung zhing nub pa dang / nub nas yang nas yang du yul tha dad par rtag tu 'jug pas na de ltar mdzad pa yang rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The action is also permanent.

original: de la dhring ni kun tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la dhring ni kun tu gnas pa ste /
translated: Here, dhrƒ´·πÖ means to abide.

original: zhes pa nyid la gang du yang 'jig par 'gyur ba med do zhes pa ni chos so //
analyzed: zhes pa nyid la gang du yang 'jig par 'gyur ba med do zhes pa ni chos so //
translated: It is said that it never perishes anywhere.

original: chos kyang 'di la sku yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos kyang 'di la sku yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The dharmakƒÅya is also like this.

original: lus yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lus yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the body.

original: chos kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i don dam pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'dus ma byas pa'i don dam pa ste /
translated: The dharmakƒÅya is the unconditioned ultimate of the bhagavƒÅns.

analyzed: ba bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de las cig shos kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sogs pa rnams la yang so sor snang bar byed de /üîΩji ltar chos kyi sku la brten pa nyid na ni chos kyi sku nyid mngon par byang chub par gyur nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rtse mo la 'di las sprul pa'i sku yang de dang der 'byung ste /

analyzed: cung zhig chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa de'i 'od zer dag las kyang sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And from the light rays of the Dharma Body, the Complete Enjoyment Body, and the Emanation Body, the Emanation Body arises.

analyzed: dngos gzhi dang rjes ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: and the conclusion are the nature of the five knowledges.

original: de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdor sangs rgyas kyi sa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis bsdus pa'i me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan no zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdor sangs rgyas kyi sa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis bsdus pa'i me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba nan tan no zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, in the Buddha-bhumi-sutra, the Buddha-stage is said to be included in the extremely pure Dharma-element, and the mirror-like, the equality, the individual-realization, and the duty-fulfillment are said to be included in the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: de la bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa gnyis las grol ba'i snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pas chos kyi dbyings kun du rtogs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //

translated: There, the realization of the Dharma-element by the non-dual compassion and wisdom liberated from the two obscurations together with their instincts is the extremely pure Dharma-element knowledge.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi so sor gnas pa me long bzhin du gzugs brnyan gsal bar so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi so sor gnas pa me long bzhin du gzugs brnyan gsal bar so sor snang ba'o //
translated: Mirror-like primordial wisdom is that by which all the limitless worlds of the three spheres, as many as there are atoms in the whole of space, and all the things that exist therein, whether far or near, past, future, or present, are clearly reflected, just as in a mirror.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang gis de ltar mthong ba'i 'gro ba de rnams chos la bdag med par mnyam par nges shing sems can thams cad rtog par bdag dang mnyam pa nyid kyi sems de rnams kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang gis de ltar mthong ba'i 'gro ba de rnams chos la bdag med par mnyam par nges shing sems can thams cad rtog par bdag dang mnyam pa nyid kyi sems de rnams kyis thob pa'o //
translated: Primordial wisdom of equality is that by which the beings who see in this way are certain of the equality of all phenomena in their lack of self and attain the state of mind that is the same as the mind of all sentient beings.

original: so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyang rang gi sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi bsod nams kyi dbang gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor brtags pa'o //
analyzed: so sor kun tu rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar mnyam par bzhag pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das la rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyang rang gi sngon gyi smon lam dang / sems can gyi bsod nams kyi dbang gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor brtags pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of discernment is that, by being thus in equipoise, the Lord, without any discursive thought, examines the mental behavior of all sentient beings by the power of his former vows and the merit of sentient beings.

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes ni de ltar so sor brtags pa nyid kyis 'gro ba la ji ltar rigs par mdzad pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes ni de ltar so sor brtags pa nyid kyis 'gro ba la ji ltar rigs par mdzad pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of performance is that, by such discernment, he abides in the performance of whatever is appropriate for the world.

original: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams dang // gzhan yang mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i grangs las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun rdzob pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa de rnams ni gang yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das ma las gsungs pa na
analyzed: ye shes lnga po 'di rnams dang // gzhan yang mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i grangs las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun rdzob pa la rnam par rtog pa med pa de rnams ni gang yang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bde ba'o zhes bcom ldan 'das ma las gsungs pa na
translated: These five wisdoms, and also the innumerable other wisdoms of the Buddha, such as the superknowledges, the powers, and the fearlessnesses, are the conventional nonconceptual wisdoms, and they are the bliss of the perfect Buddha.

original: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin te /üîΩlongs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang lhan cig spyod de /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin te / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang lhan cig spyod de /
translated: is the enjoyment body.

original: gzugs dang ro gcig bzhin du tshogs pa gcig la brten pa'i 'brel pa dang gzhan pa'i cha med pas gnas pa cig car ba'i rgyud la phan tshun dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa ni gang du yang dbye ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro gcig bzhin du tshogs pa gcig la brten pa'i 'brel pa dang gzhan pa'i cha med pas gnas pa cig car ba'i rgyud la phan tshun dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa ni gang du yang dbye ba med de /
translated: Just as form and taste are one, they are related in dependence on a single collection, and since they are not separate parts, they are simultaneously present in the continuum.

original: ldog pa'i dbye ba rnams kyi phye bas rnam par gzhag pa la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i dbye ba rnams kyi phye bas rnam par gzhag pa la dgongs pa ste /
translated: The intention is that they are presented as mutually divided, but they are not divided anywhere.

original: don dam pa ni dbye ba dang @205b dbye ba med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa mtha' dag gis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa ni dbye ba dang @205b dbye ba med pa la sogs pa'i spros pa mtha' dag gis stong pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate is the emptiness of all elaborations, such as being divisible or indivisible.

original: dbu ma pa gzhan gyis 'dod pas de nyid de ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbu ma pa gzhan gyis 'dod pas de nyid de ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Since it is asserted by other MƒÅdhyamikas, it does not exist in that way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes na ni /
translated: In the pristine consciousness of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa'i kun rdzob chad pa'i lta bas smod par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa'i kun rdzob chad pa'i lta bas smod par byed pa nyid de /
translated: the ultimate is the ultimate that is free from all elaborations, such as being divisible or indivisible.üîΩThe relative is the relative that is free from all elaborations, such as being divisible or indivisible.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i so sor rang gis rig pa ni chad pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i so sor rang gis rig pa ni chad pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the reality of the conventional is individually cognized without interruption by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rten gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis sgrib pa med pa'i phung po lnga po rnams kun rdzob tu gzhan du yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi rten gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i rang gi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi dbang gis sgrib pa med pa'i phung po lnga po rnams kun rdzob tu gzhan du yod pa nyid de /
translated: The five aggregates with obscurations are the basis, and due to the power of one‚Äôs accumulation of merit and wisdom, the five aggregates without obscurations exist conventionally as other.

original: 'dir rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa nas brtsams nas /
translated: Here, beginning from the ground Joyful,üîΩthe darkness of the opposing factors such as ignorance is diminished, and the light of wisdom such as the limitless superknowledges is gradually accumulated.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mun pa 'grib pa nyid kyis mu med pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ye shes kyi snang ba bsags pa nyid kyi rim gyis mun pa med nas sa bcu pa la mu med pa nyid kyi bdag
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa la sogs pa'i mun pa 'grib pa nyid kyis mu med pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ye shes kyi snang ba bsags pa nyid kyi rim gyis mun pa med nas sa bcu pa la mu med pa nyid kyi bdag
translated: Since there is no darkness on the tenth ground, it is the nature of the limitless.

original: nyid can du byed pas bcu gcig pa la med ces ci'i phyir 'dir rigs te /
analyzed: nyid can du byed pas bcu gcig pa la med ces ci'i phyir 'dir rigs te /
translated: Why is it logical to say that it is limitless on the eleventh ground?

original: de la ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ma lus pa'i mun pa'i 'khrul pa spangs nas dang / ma 'dres pa'i bla na med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba mu med pa'i khams gsum pa rnams na mtshams med pa 'phro ba nyid du rigs kyi chad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ni ma rig pa la sogs pa ma lus pa'i mun pa'i 'khrul pa spangs nas dang / ma 'dres pa'i bla na med pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba mu med pa'i khams gsum pa rnams na mtshams med pa 'phro ba nyid du rigs kyi chad par ni ma yin te /
translated: radiates without interruption in the three realms, but it is not a lineageüîΩthat is interrupted.üîΩIf the essence of the relative does not exist in the tantra of theüîΩrealization of utter purity, the aggregates of Dharma of pristine consciousness, knowledge, superknowledge, powers, and theüîΩuncontaminated qualities of sentient beings without end would notüîΩexist.üîΩBy the power of the great compassion that makes aspirations for

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i rgyud la kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid med na mu med pa'i sems can rnams kyi rgyud kyi rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi phung po yang ye shes lnga rnams gang gis mkhyen cing gang gis chos bstan pa rnams kyi gzhan du don byed pa snying rje chen pos smon lam btab pa rab tu sad pa'i dbang gis gang du gzugs kyi
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa rtogs pa'i rgyud la kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid med na mu med pa'i sems can rnams kyi rgyud kyi rig pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / stobs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi phung po yang ye shes lnga rnams gang gis mkhyen cing gang gis chos bstan pa rnams kyi gzhan du don byed pa snying rje chen pos smon lam btab pa rab tu sad pa'i dbang gis gang du gzugs kyi
translated: the benefit of others, the five pristine consciousnesses know andüîΩteach the Dharma.

original: sku snang bar 'gyur ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: sku snang bar 'gyur ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the body is the appearance of the Buddha,

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das ma 'di'i yongs su bsngo ba'i le 'ur rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba zhes pa des gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das ma 'di'i yongs su bsngo ba'i le 'ur rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba zhes pa des gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: then the chapter of this very Blessed Lady‚Äôs dedication, ‚ÄúThe Bliss of Complete Awakening,‚Äù would be harmed.

original: de'i phyir yang myong ba'i bdag can ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang myong ba'i bdag can ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One is the one who has the nature of experience.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'tshe ba med pa'i yang dag don //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'tshe ba med pa'i yang dag don //
translated: The nonviolent truth

original: rtogs pa shin tu rgyas rnams kyi //
analyzed: rtogs pa shin tu rgyas rnams kyi //
translated: Is for those with vast realization.üîΩIt is not nihilistic, but is grasped with bliss,

original: chad pa med de bde gzung dang // snying brtse ba'i bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: chad pa med de bde gzung dang // snying brtse ba'i bdag nyid kyis //
translated: And is of the nature of compassion.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i rigs pas ni //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i rigs pas ni //
translated: By the reasoning taught in this way,

original: thams cad kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩji ltar na des yongs su gcod par @206a * //
analyzed: thams cad kun du 'byung bar 'gyur // ji ltar na des yongs su gcod par @206a * //
translated: Everything will come to arise.üîΩHow is it that the things that are discerned by that

original: byed pa'i dngos po rnams la ni mtha' med de /
analyzed: byed pa'i dngos po rnams la ni mtha' med de /
translated: Have no end?

original: dper na bden pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pas mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: dper na bden pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pas mi slu ba ste /
translated: For example, the consciousness of a true dream is nondeceptive.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la goms pa'i mthus ma rig pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas phyogs bcur nam mkha' ji srid par byung zin pa dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la goms pa'i mthus ma rig pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas phyogs bcur nam mkha' ji srid par byung zin pa dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar
translated: Thus, the yogis and yoginis, by the power of being accustomed to the method of the perfection of wisdom, have abandoned the obscurations of ignorance and so forth. Therefore, in the ten directions, for as long as space exists, they directly perceive the nature of the conventional, which is the world of the environment that has arisen, is arising, and will arise, and the world of sentient beings, which is limitless and endless.

original: 'gyur ba'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / grangs med pa nyid kyi mtha' yas pa la de ltar de'i mngon sum ni gang yang slu ba med pas mngon sum gyi tshad mas rnam par gzhal bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i snod kyi 'jig rten dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / grangs med pa nyid kyi mtha' yas pa la de ltar de'i mngon sum ni gang yang slu ba med pas mngon sum gyi tshad mas rnam par gzhal bar bya ste /
translated: Since that direct perception is completely undeceiving, it is to be evaluated by the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos por ni des cung zhig kyang nye bar dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dngos por ni des cung zhig kyang nye bar dmigs pa med do //
translated: However, in terms of the nature of things, they do not observe anything at all.

original: de yang chos yang dag par sdud par /
analyzed: de yang chos yang dag par sdud par /
translated: In the Dharmasangiti-sutra it says:

original: mthong ba med pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi mthong ba dam pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mthong ba med pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi mthong ba dam pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The supreme seeing of all phenomena is nonseeing.

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad la bdag med pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon sum ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad la bdag med pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mngon sum ste /
translated: How is it that the selflessness of all phenomena is the direct perception of yogins?

original: de ni dngos po med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa'o zhe na /
translated: That is non-entity.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phung po lnga po rnams kyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phung po lnga po rnams kyis bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The wisdom that directly perceives reality, which is selflessness, arises from the five aggregates, which are like reflections.

original: de nyid la mthong ba med par brjod kyi /
analyzed: de nyid la mthong ba med par brjod kyi /
translated: That is called non-seeing.

original: med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the mode of negation of non-existence.

original: de ltar yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpas sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du chos thams cad nye bar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang blo gros chen po byang chub sems dpas sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du chos thams cad nye bar bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, Mahamati, bodhisattvas should teach that all phenomena are like illusions and dreams,

original: mthong ba dang mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes te de la mthong ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob la mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa nyid do zhes pa ni mdo'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro zhes te de la mthong ba'i mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob la mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni don dam pa nyid do zhes pa ni mdo'i don to //
translated: because of the characteristic of seeing and the characteristic of non-seeing. In that, the characteristic of seeing is the conventional, and the characteristic of non-seeing is the ultimate. This is the meaning of the sutra.

original: gang yang chos rnams thams cad don dam par skye ba med pa dang ro gcig pa nyid du mngon sum pas don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu mngon sum la sogs par rnam par gzhag ste /üîΩde'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum nyid la ma lus pa'i dngos por skyes pa'i rnam pa thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du gsal bar rig ste /
analyzed: gang yang chos rnams thams cad don dam par skye ba med pa dang ro gcig pa nyid du mngon sum pas don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu mngon sum la sogs par rnam par gzhag ste / de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum nyid la ma lus pa'i dngos por skyes pa'i rnam pa thams cad lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du gsal bar rig ste /
translated: Therefore, although they are ultimately essenceless, they are conventionally posited as direct perceptions and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn clearly knows all the aspects of the arising of all things as direct perceptions, as if they were myrobalan plums in the palm of his hand, because he connects yogis to inconceivable samƒÅdhis.

original: yang gsungs te /
analyzed: yang gsungs te /
translated: It is also said:

original: mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig la ni //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i skad cig gcig la ni //
translated: In a single instant of knowledge,

original: shes bya'i dkyil 'khor kun khyab pa'i //
analyzed: shes bya'i dkyil 'khor kun khyab pa'i //
translated: the entire sphere of knowledge is pervaded

original: yon tan rin chen bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: yon tan rin chen bsam mi khyab //
translated: by inconceivable precious qualities.üîΩIt continues as far as:üîΩAs long as the river flows.

original: chu bo'i 'khor ba ji srid 'jug / ces pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ye shes su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: chu bo'i 'khor ba ji srid 'jug / ces pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ye shes su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Here the BhagavƒÅn posits omniscience as a form of knowledge.

original: ma lus @206b pa'i phyin ci log spangs kyang thugs rje chen po'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis ji srid du sems can gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dang nam mkha' ji srid par gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma lus @206b pa'i phyin ci log spangs kyang thugs rje chen po'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis ji srid du sems can gyi las dang nyon mongs pa dang nam mkha' ji srid par gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Although all errors have been abandoned, by the power of the former prayers of great compassion, it remains for as long as the karma, afflictions, and space of sentient beings remain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na smon lam bskyed par byas te /üîΩji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ltar bdag gis rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i mchog tu yongs su mthar thug pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na smon lam bskyed par byas te / ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ltar bdag gis rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du ji ltar rjes su mthun pa'i sems can gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i mchog tu yongs su mthar thug pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yang
translated: The Bhagavat also made the generation of the prayer when he was a bodhisattva:üîΩ‚ÄúJust as the Bhagavat Buddhas, like a wish-fulfilling jewel without conceptuality, accomplish the benefit of sentient beings in accordance with their dispositions,

original: ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du gnas nas phan par byed ces pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du gnas nas phan par byed ces pa ste /
translated: I will also, having attained the supreme, ultimate buddha activity, remain for as long as space remains, and benefit.‚Äù

original: 'dir de ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i rang gi rgyu tshogs pa'i gzhan dbang gis 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir de ltar sgyu ma la sogs pa rnams sngags dang sman la sogs pa'i rang gi rgyu tshogs pa'i gzhan dbang gis 'jug ste /
translated: Here, in that way, illusions and so on are engaged by the power of other conditions, such as the collection of causes of the mantra, medicine, and so on.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes la sogs pa yang sgyu ma ste ma brtags na nyams dga' ba rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi ye shes la sogs pa yang sgyu ma ste ma brtags na nyams dga' ba rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: In that way, the engagement of illusions and so on that are delightful when not examined is also the engagement of the wisdom and so on of yogins.

original: rkyen sna tshogs pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma rnams kyang sna tshogs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen sna tshogs pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma rnams kyang sna tshogs par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because illusions are displayed as various things by the power of various conditions.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: Yogins

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po bzhin du des sgyu ma ji ltar yang dag par yongs su shes nas de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po bzhin du des sgyu ma ji ltar yang dag par yongs su shes nas de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de /
translated: are like illusionists. Having understood illusions just as they are, they do not conceive of them as real.

original: gang zhig de'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sgyu ma rnams la byis pas rtogs ldan gyi skye bo bzhin du ji ltar mthong ba la bden pa mngon par zhen pas de ni byis pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: gang zhig de'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sgyu ma rnams la byis pas rtogs ldan gyi skye bo bzhin du ji ltar mthong ba la bden pa mngon par zhen pas de ni byis pa zhes brjod la /
translated: Those who conceive of the illusions of arising and so on as real in the way that they are seen are called ‚Äúfoolish.‚Äù

original: de la rnal 'byor ba'i ye shes la sogs pa sgyu ma ni ji ltar rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ba'i ye shes la sogs pa sgyu ma ni ji ltar rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyu ste /
translated: The illusion of the gnosis of the yogi and so forth is the cause of the accumulation of merit and gnosis that is in accordance with oneself.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ni snying rje dang shes rab bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ni snying rje dang shes rab bo //
translated: The cause of the non-abiding nirvana of the Bhagavans is compassion and wisdom.

original: de'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i bgrod pa'i lam gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel ba'i bgrod pa'i lam gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the path of the union of method and wisdom is taught to the bodhisattvas.

original: 'o na chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba can gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par shes pa dag kha cig tu ji skad du bshad pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku
analyzed: 'o na chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba can gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar phyi rol gyi don dang rnam par shes pa dag kha cig tu ji skad du bshad pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku
translated: Well then, how is it that the Bhagavans, who see the suchness of the emptiness of all phenomena, teach external objects and consciousnesses as having the nature of the three bodies in some places?

original: de'i kha cig tu yod ces pa dang kha cig tu dgag par byed na kun rdzob tu yod par byed de kun rdzob ces ni mi brjod pa ni bden par mngon par zhen pa can gyi gdul bar bya ba 'jug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i kha cig tu yod ces pa dang kha cig tu dgag par byed na kun rdzob tu yod par byed de kun rdzob ces ni mi brjod pa ni bden par mngon par zhen pa can gyi gdul bar bya ba 'jug pa'i don du'o //
translated: If it were to be affirmed in one place and denied in another, it would be existent in the conventional sense, but it is not called ‚Äúconventional‚Äù because it is a subject matter for those who are attached to the idea of reality.

original: don dam par dgag pa byed de /
analyzed: don dam par dgag pa byed de /
translated: It is denied in the ultimate sense.

original: bden pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i rjes @207a * //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i rjes @207a * //
translated: The denial is in accordance with the superimposition of reality,

original: su brjod pa ji ltar na rjes su brjod pa de stong pa nyid mthong ba la ni sgro btags kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su brjod pa ji ltar na rjes su brjod pa de stong pa nyid mthong ba la ni sgro btags kyi snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the superimposition does not appear to one who sees emptiness.

original: 'jig rten gyi blo nyid kyi rjes su brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi blo nyid kyi rjes su brjod pa ste /
translated: The denial is in accordance with the mundane point of view.

original: 'jig rten gyi blo de lta bu blo ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi blo de lta bu blo ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: The mundane point of view is due to beginningless nescience,

original: des 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems bzhin du shes pa nyid kyis rjes su brjod nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: des 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems bzhin du shes pa nyid kyis rjes su brjod nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: and the Lord, in accordance with that, denies in the same way that one who is attached, etc., is conscious.

original: rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis skal ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams la ston par byed pa'i ston pa po nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis skal ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams la ston par byed pa'i ston pa po nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is without conceptualization, it is observed as the teacher itself, which teaches disciples who are fortunate by the power of its former impetus, like a revolving wheel.

original: skyes bu nor bu rin chen bzhin //
analyzed: skyes bu nor bu rin chen bzhin //
translated: Like a person with a precious gem,

original: kun du dmigs pa tsam gyis te //üîΩji ltar 'dod pa'i rtsig sogs las //
analyzed: kun du dmigs pa tsam gyis te // ji ltar 'dod pa'i rtsig sogs las //
translated: it is by mere observation that

original: ston pa'i sgra ni 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: ston pa'i sgra ni 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: the sound of the teacher arises from the wall, etc., as desired,

original: de la rtog pa med kyang ni //
analyzed: de la rtog pa med kyang ni //
translated: even though it has no conceptualization,

original: sngon gyi 'phen pas 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pas 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: it functions by the former impetus.

original: kun du sems can kun don la //
analyzed: kun du sems can kun don la //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings,

original: phyogs rnams kun du tha dad do //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun du tha dad do //
translated: it is different in all directions.

original: zhes te zhar la 'ongs pa spros pas dgos pa med do //
analyzed: zhes te zhar la 'ongs pa spros pas dgos pa med do //
translated: There is no need for elaboration on this digression.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku de'i mdzad pa mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi chos kyi sku de'i mdzad pa mdor bsdus nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The activity of the body of Dharma, which has the nature of the three bodies as explained, is summarized and taught:

original: seng ge'i sgra zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The lion's roar of the great sages,

original: ri dags rnams kyi mchog ni seng ge la de dang chos mthun pas lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams thams cad kyi skyes bu'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: ri dags rnams kyi mchog ni seng ge la de dang chos mthun pas lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams thams cad kyi skyes bu'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The lion is the king of beasts, and the Tathagata is the king of men, gods, and so forth, because he is similar to the lion in the following respects.

original: des na seng ge zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na seng ge zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore he is called the lion.

original: de'i chos ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / pha rol gyi rgol ba'i ri dags rnams 'jigs par byed pas seng ge'i sgra zhes brjod de /üîΩseng ge'i rgyal mtshan bzhin la /
analyzed: de'i chos ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / pha rol gyi rgol ba'i ri dags rnams 'jigs par byed pas seng ge'i sgra zhes brjod de / seng ge'i rgyal mtshan bzhin la /
translated: His Dharma is called the lion's roar because it terrifies the deerlike opponents and fulfills all wishes, like the banner of the lion.

original: de'i sgra ni ston pa po ste /
analyzed: de'i sgra ni ston pa po ste /
translated: The lion's roar is the teacher,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ste /üîΩdes shes rab kyis dgongs par byas nas pha rol tu 'gro bas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ste / des shes rab kyis dgongs par byas nas pha rol tu 'gro bas na /
translated: the Lord Buddha.üîΩHaving reflected with wisdom, he goes beyond,

original: pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o //
translated: so he is known as the one who has gone beyond.

original: de yang seng ge'i sgras ni mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun bstan pa la /
analyzed: de yang seng ge'i sgras ni mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun bstan pa la /
translated: The lion's roar indicates twenty seven deeds.

original: de ni rgyas par yum chen mor blta bar bya ste /üîΩde'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ni rgyas par yum chen mor blta bar bya ste / de'i dbang du byas te /
translated: These should be understood in detail from the Great Mother.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In this regard, the treatise states:

translated: To bring about the welfare of beings inüîΩaccord with their dispositions,üîΩTo bring about the welfare of beings inüîΩaccord with their dispositions,üîΩTo bring about the welfare of beings inüîΩaccord with their dispositions,

translated: To bring about the welfare of beings inüîΩaccord with their dispositions,

original: rnam par byang dang tshogs dang ni //
analyzed: rnam par byang dang tshogs dang ni //
translated: And for purification, accumulation,

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa la //
translated: and the conditioned and unconditioned,üîΩnot knowing the distinctions,

original: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // mya ngan 'das la dgod pa ste //
analyzed: tha dad yongs su mi shes dang // mya ngan 'das la dgod pa ste //
translated: and establishing in nirvana.

original: chos kyi sku yi phrin las ni //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yi phrin las ni //
translated: The activity of the dharmakaya

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be twenty-seven types.

original: ces te / bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams gzung ba'i don du sprul pa ste /
analyzed: ces te / bcom ldan 'das kyis de rnams gzung ba'i don du sprul pa ste /
translated: For the sake of those beings, the Bhagavat emanates as follows:üîΩFor the sake of those in the hells, he emanates as a fire that pacifies the hell beings' fires and as a rain cloud that satisfies them with cool water.üîΩFor the sake of animals, he emanates as a gift of his own flesh and so on.üîΩFor the sake of hungry ghosts, he emanates as food, drink, and so on.

original: gang dmyal ba rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me zhi ba dang / dud 'gro rnams la rang gi sha la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang / yi dags la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin pa nyid kyis chos ston pa la sems mngon par dad par byed pas de rnams lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed pa nas lha nas yang theg pa dman pa la mos pa'i chos bstan pas
analyzed: gang dmyal ba rnams kyi dmyal ba'i me zhi ba dang / dud 'gro rnams la rang gi sha la sogs pa'i sbyin pa dang / yi dags la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin pa nyid kyis chos ston pa la sems mngon par dad par byed pas de rnams lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed pa nas lha nas yang theg pa dman pa la mos pa'i chos bstan pas
translated: By teaching the dharma, he causes their minds to have faith and he causes them to be born as gods and humans.

original: mngon par dad par byed pas mi rnams su skye bar byed pa nas ji srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi bar la 'god par byed do zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i phrin las so //
analyzed: mngon par dad par byed pas mi rnams su skye bar byed pa nas ji srid du nyan thos kyi byang chub kyi bar la 'god par byed do zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i phrin las so //
translated: He causes them to be born among humans, and he establishes them up to the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvaka. This is the pacifying activity for beings.

original: gang yang mi rnams la nang dang phyi rol gyi zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa rnams kyi don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams kyis slob par byed do zhes pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: gang yang mi rnams la nang dang phyi rol gyi zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams dang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa rnams kyi don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa rnams kyis slob par byed do zhes pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: He causes them to practice the four means of gathering students, the giving of material things internally and externally, and the giving of the Dharma, mundane and supramundane. This is the activity of establishing in the four means of gathering students.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa la /
translated: In regard to the obscurations of the afflictive emotions and the obscurations to knowledge,

original: rnam par byang ba ni de dag 'gags pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni de dag 'gags pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: purification is their cessation.

original: de yang gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i shes pas so zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de yang gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i shes pas so zhes pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Moreover, it is by the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and things. This is the evolutionary action of establishing the knowledge of the addictions and of purification.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po sprul te /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po sprul te /
translated: For example, a magician conjures up various things,

original: de yang 'jig rten pas de thams cad rdzas med pa'o zhes mi shes te /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pas de thams cad rdzas med pa'o zhes mi shes te /
translated: and the world does not know that they are substanceless.

original: gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du phung po la sogs pa mthong la /
analyzed: gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du phung po la sogs pa mthong la /
translated: But when one practices the perfection of wisdom, one sees the aggregates, etc., as identical with emptiness, their own essence.

original: don dam par ni sems can yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni sems can yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But ultimately, there are no sentient beings,

original: btags pa'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pas so zhes pa ni @208a * //
analyzed: btags pa'i chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pas so zhes pa ni @208a * //
translated: because the phenomena of conceptual things are essenceless.

original: sems can gyi don la ji lta ba bzhin du bdag nyid 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la ji lta ba bzhin du bdag nyid 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the evolutionary action of establishing the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing gzhan rnams kyang sbyin pa la 'god par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing gzhan rnams kyang sbyin pa la 'god par byed pa ni /
translated: He gives gifts and establishes others in giving.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung bar byed ces pa la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Likewise, the words ‚Äúthey cause them to observe moral discipline‚Äù and so on refer to the activity of establishing them in the six perfections.

original: de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par blangs so zhes pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par blangs so zhes pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi lam la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: The words ‚Äúthey cause them to take up the path of the ten virtues‚Äù and so on refer to the activity of establishing them in the path of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The perfections and so on are the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi 'khor gsum dang 'bras bu ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du bstan cing /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'khor gsum dang 'bras bu ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du bstan cing /
translated: Their three spheres and their results are taught to be emptiness by nature.

original: de de rnams kyi ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub rtogs par 'gyur gyi bar sgom par byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de de rnams kyi ji srid du bla na med pa'i byang chub rtogs par 'gyur gyi bar sgom par byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: They meditate on that until they realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid la mngon par 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la mngon par 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing them in emptiness.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la rang bzhin gyi stong pa nyid kyi chos rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe phenomena of the emptiness of nature are empty of the emptiness of nature‚Äù is the activity of establishing nondual phenomena.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos gang yang don dam par ma dmigs la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos gang yang don dam par ma dmigs la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, the perfect, complete Buddha, did not apprehend any phenomena ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni chos rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa ste /
translated: He fully awakened to phenomena conventionally and then taught them.

original: phung po khams la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni brda can gyi ye shes la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: phung po khams la sogs pa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni brda can gyi ye shes la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: The aggregates, constituents, and so forth, the perfections, and the knowledge of all aspects and so forth are the activity of establishing the gnosis of symbols.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la de rnams kyi 'khor gsum dang 'bras bu nye bar mi dmigs dang de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas par nus so zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la de rnams kyi 'khor gsum dang 'bras bu nye bar mi dmigs dang de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas par nus so zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: If one is able to not observe the three spheres and so forth in the dharmas of the perfections and so forth, one is able to fully and completely awaken to buddhahood. This is the activity of establishing non-observation.

original: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can rnams don dam par dmigs su med pa de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu sems can la lta ste /
analyzed: gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sems can rnams don dam par dmigs su med pa de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu sems can la lta ste /
translated: Even though the bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom does not observe sentient beings ultimately, still he looks at sentient beings conventionally.

original: sems can rnams ni dngos por mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni dngos por mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Sentient beings are afflicted by clinging to things.

original: de de rnams kyis te spong ba'i phyir theg pa gsum po rnams kyis yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni sems can yongs su smin pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de de rnams kyis te spong ba'i phyir theg pa gsum po rnams kyis yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni sems can yongs su smin pa'i phrin las so //
translated: In order to abandon that, he brings them to full maturity through the three vehicles. This is the activity of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa re re la sogs pa la spyod pa'i dkar po'i chos rnams la sems can rnams kyis @208b dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la slob par byed do zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa re re la sogs pa la spyod pa'i dkar po'i chos rnams la sems can rnams kyis @208b dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la slob par byed do zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: He causes sentient beings to train in the emptiness of all phenomena. This is the enlightened activity of establishing in the path of the bodhisattva.

original: de de ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su brtags te chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par byed la de rnams dang de'i 'bras bu rnams la bzlog par bya'o
analyzed: de de ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su brtags te chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid la stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod par byed la de rnams dang de'i 'bras bu rnams la bzlog par bya'o
translated: Thus, having investigated emptiness, he does not settle down upon the emptiness of all phenomena as emptiness, and he practices generosity and so forth. He turns away from them and their results.

original: zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spong ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa thams cad spong ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the enlightened activity of establishing in the abandonment of all settling down.

original: byang chub nyid ni lam la lam nyid ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: byang chub nyid ni lam la lam nyid ni byang chub ste /
translated: Enlightenment itself is the path, and the path itself is enlightenment.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur te de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas gang du byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te de nyid gshegs pas so zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur te de yang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas gang du byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te de nyid gshegs pas so zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva becomes a buddha, and since he has perfected all the qualities of a buddha, he goes to the place where he will realize enlightenment.

original: de phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi gnas ngan len bzlog cing rang dang gzhan rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams thams cad la 'god de /
analyzed: de phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi gnas ngan len bzlog cing rang dang gzhan rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rnams thams cad la 'god de /
translated: He turns beings away from the negative tendencies of the habitual notion of the aggregates, elements and so forth and establishes them in the virtues of the transcendent perfections and so forth.

original: de'i dge bas rang dang gzhan rnams rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba dang smon lam 'debs par byed do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so
analyzed: de'i dge bas rang dang gzhan rnams rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba dang smon lam 'debs par byed do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so
translated: And through their virtues, he dedicates them to perfect enlightenment and makes prayers of aspiration for the purification of his own and others' buddha realms.

original: // de ltar sems dang po bskyed pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges la nges pa ji ltar na ngan 'gror skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // de ltar sems dang po bskyed pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges la nges pa ji ltar na ngan 'gror skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can one who is certain to be reborn in the lower realms?

original: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: gang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: One who has generated the thought of perfect awakening

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnams la spyod pa de la ni mi khom pa brgyad mi srid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnams la spyod pa de la ni mi khom pa brgyad mi srid do //
translated: and practices the six perfections and so on cannot possibly have the eight inopportune states.

original: de lta na ni ji ltar dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skye na /
analyzed: de lta na ni ji ltar dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skye na /
translated: If that is so, how can one be reborn in the animal realm?

original: des zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pas sems can gyi don du skye ba la dbang bas bsams bzhin du len gyi dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pas sems can gyi don du skye ba la dbang bas bsams bzhin du len gyi dud 'gro'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Since one who is reborn there possesses all the contaminated and uncontaminated virtuous qualities, one is reborn for the sake of sentient beings through the power of aspiration. One does not experience the feelings of suffering of an animal.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mchog la dbang ba nyid du thob pas 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mchog la dbang ba nyid du thob pas 'jig rten gyi khams rnams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi dkyil 'khor du rab tu zhugs nas /
translated: The Tathagata, having attained mastery over the supreme, simultaneously emanates infinite other bodies for the sake of others, having entered into the mandala of the atoms of all world systems.

original: cig car du mtha' yas pa'i bdag gi lus gzhan gyi don du sprul bar byed do zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nges par 'god pa'i phrin las so //üîΩde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig @209a * //
analyzed: cig car du mtha' yas pa'i bdag gi lus gzhan gyi don du sprul bar byed do zhes pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la nges par 'god pa'i phrin las so // de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig @209a * //
translated: This is the activity of definitely establishing in perfect complete enlightenment.

original: rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams ni sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang gos pa med de stong pa nyid la gnas nas dkar po'i chos rnams thams cad la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams ni sems can rnams kyi don byed kyang gos pa med de stong pa nyid la gnas nas dkar po'i chos rnams thams cad la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom, he acts for the sake of sentient beings in the innumerable world systems of the ten directions, yet without being defiled. Abiding in emptiness, he abides in all virtuous dharmas.

original: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid las gzhan na med pas so zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi don la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid las gzhan na med pas so zhes pa ni gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi don la dgod pa'i phrin las so //
translated: Since all dharmas are not other than emptiness. This is the activity of establishing innumerable sentient beings in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: des 'di ltar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: des 'di ltar bstan par bya ste /
translated: This should be explained as follows.

original: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang ga'i klung g'i bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang de rnams thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bos stong pa ste /
analyzed: gang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang ga'i klung g'i bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gang de rnams thams cad kyang rang gi ngo bos stong pa ste /
translated: All those tathƒÅgatas in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, are also empty of their own nature.

original: gal te de stong pa nyid du ma gyur na de phyogs gcig par 'gyur bas de'i chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: gal te de stong pa nyid du ma gyur na de phyogs gcig par 'gyur bas de'i chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: If they were not empty, they would be one-sided. Therefore, all their phenomena are empty of all phenomena. Abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: mngon par shes pa drug mngon par bsgrubs nas de ltar yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi don skad cig ma gcig la 'gro ba drug gi sems can gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog tu sprul pa rnams kyis
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug mngon par bsgrubs nas de ltar yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi don skad cig ma gcig la 'gro ba drug gi sems can gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog tu sprul pa rnams kyis
translated: having accomplished the six superknowledges, in a single instant they go to the countless world systems of the ten directions and with emanations in the various colors of the forms of the beings of the six realms of migrating beings,

original: yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
translated: they accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.

original: lha la sogs pa nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ji srid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams la sprul pa'i dbyangs kyis rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor ji srid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams la sprul pa'i dbyangs kyis rtogs par byed de /
translated: They emanate sound through their emanations in order to teach the Dharma to sentient beings in the ten directions, such as gods and so on, as well as to the retinues of sravakas and bodhisattvas.

original: dbyangs des kyang rnam pa du ma'i chos rnams ston par byed la /
analyzed: dbyangs des kyang rnam pa du ma'i chos rnams ston par byed la /
translated: That sound teaches the Dharma in many ways.

original: gzhan sprul pa rnams la byed du 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan sprul pa rnams la byed du 'jug pa'am /
translated: It causes others to emanate orüîΩit causes the sound of the Dharma to arise in space.

original: nam mkha' la yang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar byed pas yul dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang bzhon pa dang gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems can gyi don du sprul pa de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i de bzhin
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung bar byed pas yul dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang bzhon pa dang gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems can gyi don du sprul pa de rdzu 'phrul gyis phyogs bcu'i de bzhin
translated: Through their emanations, they benefit sentient beings by emanating various things such as food and drink, vehicles, clothing, jewels and so on.üîΩThrough their miraculous powers, they approach the tathagatas of the ten directions and serve them.

original: gshegs pa rjes su nye bar song ba de rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing de rnams la chos mnyan nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gshegs pa rjes su nye bar song ba de rnams la bsnyen bkur byed cing de rnams la chos mnyan nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan skyed par byed de /
translated: They listen to the Dharma from them and generate other roots of virtue.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni mi byed de /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni mi byed de /
translated: But they do not cling to them.

original: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no attachment to emptiness by means of emptiness.

original: de'i lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can rnams mthong nas rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par shes pas der song nas khyab bdag thob par byas nas de rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can rnams mthong nas rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par shes pas der song nas khyab bdag thob par byas nas de rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: With his divine eye, he sees the sentient beings of the world systems of the ten directions. Having gone there by means of the superknowledge of magical power, having attained mastery, he teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings.

original: lha'i rna bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la chos nyan cing 'dzin par byas nas de rnams la ston par byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rna bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams la chos nyan cing 'dzin par byas nas de rnams la ston par byed do //
translated: With his divine ear, he hears the Dharma from the Buddhas of the ten directions and, having retained it, he teaches it to others.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs @209b shes shing sems can rnams kyi spyod pa shes nas ji ltar sems pa de la de bstan pa rnams kyi chos ston par byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs @209b shes shing sems can rnams kyi spyod pa shes nas ji ltar sems pa de la de bstan pa rnams kyi chos ston par byed de /
translated: With the superknowledge of knowing the minds of others, he knows the conduct of sentient beings and teaches the Dharma to them, having shown them what they wish for.

original: des rnam pa du ma'i bdag nyid kyis sngon gyi gnas dang gzhan dag gis rjes su dran pa nas sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang chos kyi rjes su dran nas de'i gdul bya'i sems can rnams la ston par byed do //üîΩde'i zag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zad nas ji srid du chos rnams thams cad ni chos rnams thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes pa'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas sems can rnams la rjes su mthun
analyzed: des rnam pa du ma'i bdag nyid kyis sngon gyi gnas dang gzhan dag gis rjes su dran pa nas sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang chos kyi rjes su dran nas de'i gdul bya'i sems can rnams la ston par byed do // de'i zag pa shes pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa zad nas ji srid du chos rnams thams cad ni chos rnams thams cad kyis stong ngo zhes pa'i bar du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen nas sems can rnams la rjes su mthun
translated: By means of that, he recalls his own former abodes in many ways and those of others, and having recalled the former TathƒÅgatas and the Dharma, he teaches those sentient beings who are his disciples.

original: pa'i chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: pa'i chos ston par byed do //
translated: Having understood as it is that the nature of the knowledge of the defilements and the cessation of the afflictions of others, up to all phenomena are empty of all phenomena, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in accordance with theirüîΩminds.

original: gang yang de'i tshig la gnas par mi 'dod pa de rnams kyi mgo bo 'gas pa la sogs pas bsdigs nas bskul ba rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi gsung 'dzin du gzhug par byed do //
analyzed: gang yang de'i tshig la gnas par mi 'dod pa de rnams kyi mgo bo 'gas pa la sogs pas bsdigs nas bskul ba rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi gsung 'dzin du gzhug par byed do //
translated: Those who do not wish to abide in his words, he compels them to accept his speech by threatening them with the splitting of their heads and so forth.

original: de'i mngon par shes pa de rnams kyis gang du 'dod par sems can gyi don bdag gis lus 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i mngon par shes pa de rnams kyis gang du 'dod par sems can gyi don bdag gis lus 'dzin par byed do //
translated: By means of those superknowledges, he assumes bodies at will for the benefit of beings.

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba rnams kyis gos pa med de /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba rnams kyis gos pa med de /
translated: He is not defiled by attachment to pleasure or aversion to pain.

original: 'di'i mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang skye bo so so la kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i mngon par shes pa thams cad kyang skye bo so so la kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: All his superknowledges are manifest to individuals.üîΩHe does not die in the animal world, etc.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa'i 'chi ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas la sogs pa'i 'chi ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of serving the Buddhas of the ten directions, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva‚Äôs enlightenment member?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar te /
translated: It is the six perfections, up to the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: gal te de rnams la spyod na 'khor gsum du dmigs pa med pas rang dang gzhan la yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir der yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te de rnams la spyod na 'khor gsum du dmigs pa med pas rang dang gzhan la yang dag par rtog par byed pa'i phyir der yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: If he practices them, he dedicates them to the realization of self and other, since he is without the concepts of the three spheres.
