original: gal te 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chos yin na /
translated: If these are the bodhisattva‚Äôs qualities,

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin zhe na /
translated: what are the qualities of a buddha?

original: de'i phyir gang 'di rnams nyid kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor bar thams cad rab tu spangs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang 'di rnams nyid kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor bar thams cad rab tu spangs par gyur nas /
translated: Therefore, when the bodhisattva has completely abandoned all the instincts for those very qualities,

original: chos thams cad la mngon par byang chub pa na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par byang chub pa na /
translated: and has fully awakened to all qualities,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no zhes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: then he is not a bodhisattva. This is the action of establishing the branches of enlightenment.

original: gal te yang chos rnams thams cad don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ste de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu las yod cing las kyi 'bras bu yod de /
analyzed: gal te yang chos rnams thams cad don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ste de ltar na yang kun rdzob tu las yod cing las kyi 'bras bu yod de /
translated: Even though all phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic identity, still conventionally karma exists and the result of karma exists.

original: sems can rnams kyi @210a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi @210a * //
translated: The bodhisattva, who is skilled in the methods of the Great Vehicle,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams shes par ma gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams shes par ma gyur la /
translated: They do not understand that phenomena are empty of their own characteristics.

original: ma shes pas gang zag dang chos rnams su rtogs par byas nas las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: ma shes pas gang zag dang chos rnams su rtogs par byas nas las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: Not understanding that, they conceive of persons and phenomena and create karma.

original: de'i ngan du spyod pa des ngan 'gro gsum du ltung bar byed cing legs par spyad pas ni lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i ngan du spyod pa des ngan 'gro gsum du ltung bar byed cing legs par spyad pas ni lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: By their bad conduct, they fall into the three lower realms, and by their good conduct, they are born as gods and humans.

original: kha cig gis ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes nas bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro spangs nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes nas bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro spangs nas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some, by understanding the selflessness of persons, avoid good and bad rebirths and attain nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas

original: gnyi ga'i bdag med pa shes shing pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag med pa shes shing pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i tshogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: understand the selflessness of both and, having completed the accumulations of virtue such as the perfections,

original: rim gyis sa bcu rtogs nas skad cig ma gcig la yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams thams cad mngon par byang chub nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa chud mi za ba la 'god
analyzed: rim gyis sa bcu rtogs nas skad cig ma gcig la yang dag par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams thams cad mngon par byang chub nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes pa ni las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa chud mi za ba la 'god
translated: Having gradually realized the ten grounds, in a single instant, through the wisdom of perfect realization, they fully awaken to all phenomena and become a buddha, a BhagavƒÅn.

original: pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: pa'i phrin las so //
translated: This is the activity of establishing the unfailing connection between actions and results.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not attain nirvƒÅ·πáa through the knowledge of the truths.

original: ji ltar na bden pa bzhi yang ngo bo nyid med pas des chos cung zad kyang bden pa'am mi bden par mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bden pa bzhi yang ngo bo nyid med pas des chos cung zad kyang bden pa'am mi bden par mi dmigs te /
translated: Since the four truths are also devoid of essence, they do not observe even the slightest phenomenon as either true or false.

original: des chos rnams thams cad stong pa'o zhes mthong bas sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang lam sgom par byed na bden par dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa med pa'i chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba'i thabs la mkhas pas chos ston par byed do zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las
analyzed: des chos rnams thams cad stong pa'o zhes mthong bas sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang lam sgom par byed na bden par dmigs pa'i sems bskyed pa med pa'i chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba'i thabs la mkhas pas chos ston par byed do zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi la 'god pa'i phrin las
translated: Since they see that all phenomena are empty, they fully understand suffering, abandon its origin, manifest its cessation, and cultivate the path.

original: so // byams pas gsol pa /
analyzed: so // byams pas gsol pa /
translated: Maitreya asked:

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' phung po rnams nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du bslab par bya la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' phung po rnams nas ji srid du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du bslab par bya la /
translated: If all phenomena are the non-entityness of entities, how can bodhisattvas train in the aggregates, and so on, up to and including the qualities of buddhahood?

original: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid brjod du med pa'i dbyings zhes pa rnam par nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'du byed kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po de nyid brjod du med pa'i dbyings zhes pa rnam par nyams pa nyid do //
translated: If the very entity of the sign of conditioned phenomena is the inexpressible expanse, then it is destroyed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: gang brjod du med pa'i dbyings shes rab kyi rgyu bas nye bar dmigs par gyur nas /
analyzed: gang brjod du med pa'i dbyings shes rab kyi rgyu bas nye bar dmigs par gyur nas /
translated: When the inexpressible realm is observed by the movement of wisdom,

original: de 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: de 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma'i dngos po'am /
translated: is it an entity with the sign of the conditioned?üîΩMaitreya replied, ‚ÄúNo, it is not.‚Äù

original: gsol pa de ni ma lags so zhes pa dang / byams pa mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩkun brtags pa'i @210b ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes te /
analyzed: gsol pa de ni ma lags so zhes pa dang / byams pa mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste / kun brtags pa'i @210b ngo bo nyid dang / rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes te /
translated: ‚Äú Maitreya, there are three characteristics:üîΩthe imagined nature, the dependent nature, and the perfected nature.‚Äù

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du kun du brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: In order, these are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected natures.

original: de la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phung po lnga rnams la gang du don dam par yod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa nyid yin pa'i phung po lnga rnams la gang du don dam par yod pa nyid dam /
translated: In the five aggregates that are like an illusory person, where is there ultimately existence?

original: med pa nyid dang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa de thams cad ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid dang gnyi ga ma yin pa dang / gzhan yang rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa de thams cad ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de brtags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: All of those superimpositions of existence, nonexistence, both, and neither, and also permanence and so on are the imagined nature, the imagined essence.

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa la skyes pa ni gzhan dbang ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa la skyes pa ni gzhan dbang ste /
translated: Those five aggregates and so on, like an illusory person and so on, are produced in dependence on causes and conditions in the relative and are the dependent nature.

original: de rnams kun rdzob kyi ngo bor gnas shing /
analyzed: de rnams kun rdzob kyi ngo bor gnas shing /
translated: They abide as the essence of the relative.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The absence of the imagined nature and the dependent nature is the perfect nature.

original: de rnams nyid kyi phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin pa gang zhig ni rang bzhin nyid kyis don dam pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyi phung po lnga la sogs pa rnams la sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sogs pa bzhin pa gang zhig ni rang bzhin nyid kyis don dam pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The five aggregates and so on that are like an illusory person and so on are the perfect nature, the perfected essence.

original: rtag par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don dam pa ste /
analyzed: rtag par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi don dam pa ste /
translated: The permanent naturelessness is emptiness, the reality-limit, the reality of phenomena, the ultimate, and the dharma-element.

original: de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid /
analyzed: de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid /
translated: That is the perfected nature.

original: rtag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is permanent.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Thus, the noble Descent into Lanka says,

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo med pa dang // gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid //üîΩsgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo med pa dang // gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
translated: The imagined nature does not exist; the dependent exists.üîΩImagined and dependent natures

original: mtha' la rtog pa brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtha' la rtog pa brlag par 'gyur //
translated: are taught in order to abandon the extremes of superimposition and deprecation.

original: zhes te / 'dir gang zhig ji skad du bshad pa'i kun tu brtags pas dngos po la ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed de de'i sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa'i tshul du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes te / 'dir gang zhig ji skad du bshad pa'i kun tu brtags pas dngos po la ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed de de'i sgro 'dogs pa dgag pa'i tshul du gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the imagined nature is the superimposition of an entity‚Äôs reality on it in the way that it has been explained. The statement in order to abandon the extreme of superimposition is

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes pa'o //
translated: The imagined nature does not exist.

original: gang yang kun rdzob ces pa'i ji skad du bshad pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang kun rdzob ces pa'i ji skad du bshad pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the reality of the relative, as explained, is not nonexistent.

original: de'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of that is stated:

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: The relative is just existent.

original: gang yang ji skad bshad pa'i 'di ltar mtha' gnyis su brtags pas zhes pas dbu ma sgrub pa la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang ji skad bshad pa'i 'di ltar mtha' gnyis su brtags pas zhes pas dbu ma sgrub pa la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Also, it is stated that the middle way is to be entered by the analysis of the two extremes, as explained:

original: g-yang sa'i gnas na gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: g-yang sa'i gnas na gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of abiding in the abode of the abyss,

original: brlag par 'gyur ba gsungs pa ni //üîΩsgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
analyzed: brlag par 'gyur ba gsungs pa ni // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs pa'i //
translated: destruction is stated.üîΩThe conception of the extremes of

original: mtha' la rtog pa brlag par 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' la rtog pa brlag par 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: superimposition and deprecation is destroyed.

original: @211a * // 'dir gang zhig de dang der gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par bstan pa dang / dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob pa nyid kyi ngo bor skye bo'i dbang du byas nas skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: @211a * // 'dir gang zhig de dang der gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod par bstan pa dang / dngos po rnams kyi skye ba la sogs pa bstan pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob pa nyid kyi ngo bor skye bo'i dbang du byas nas skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i don du ste /
translated: Here, whatever is taught as the existence of the dependent nature in this and that, and whatever is taught as the arising, etc. of things, all that is taught as the nature of the superficial, from the perspective of the world, in order to completely eliminate the possibility of fear.

original: byis pa rnams gzhug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams gzhug pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is taught with the intention of introducing the childish.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not ultimately,

original: mdo sde rnams la de bkag ste ji skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: mdo sde rnams la de bkag ste ji skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: for it is refuted in the s≈´tras. As it says in the noble Journey to Lanka:

original: blo yis rnam par phye byas nas //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par phye byas nas //
translated: Having been analyzed by the mind,

original: gzhan dbang med cing kun brtags med //
analyzed: gzhan dbang med cing kun brtags med //
translated: there is no dependent, and no imagined;

original: grub pa'i ngo bo yod min na //
analyzed: grub pa'i ngo bo yod min na //
translated: if the nature of the real does not exist,

original: ji ltar blo ni rnam brtags min ;
analyzed: ji ltar blo ni rnam brtags min ;
translated: how can the mind be imagined?

original: / ngo bo nyid dang rnam shes dang // dngos po dang ni gnas med de //
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid dang rnam shes dang // dngos po dang ni gnas med de //
translated: There is no nature, consciousness, thing, or basis;

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i dbang gyur pa'i //
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i dbang gyur pa'i //
translated: they are under the influence of bad reasoning.

original: byis pa rnams kyis 'di rnams brtag / ces gsungs te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis 'di rnams brtag / ces gsungs te /
translated: Children investigate these.

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis kyang /
translated: ƒÄrya NƒÅgƒÅrjuna also says:

original: stong nyid bdag nyid gcig dngos la //
analyzed: stong nyid bdag nyid gcig dngos la //
translated: The one entity of emptiness

original: sems kyis 'di rnams brtags pa ste //
analyzed: sems kyis 'di rnams brtags pa ste //
translated: is investigated by the mind in these.

original: brtags pa dang ni gzhan dbang dang // de bzhin yongs su grub nyid de //
analyzed: brtags pa dang ni gzhan dbang dang // de bzhin yongs su grub nyid de //
translated: Imagined, dependent, and likewise, the consummate

original: ma skyes pas na chos rnams ni //
analyzed: ma skyes pas na chos rnams ni //
translated: are not produced, and therefore phenomena

original: stong pa nyid ces rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces rab tu bsgrags //
translated: are proclaimed to be emptiness.

original: phung po lnga ni mdor bsdus na //
analyzed: phung po lnga ni mdor bsdus na //
translated: The five aggregates, in brief,

original: chos rnams thams cad ces su brjod //üîΩces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces su brjod // ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: are called all phenomena.

original: de ltar na don dam par ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi sgro btags pa dang
analyzed: de ltar na don dam par ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi sgro btags pa dang
translated: Thus, the nature of the conventional, which is of one taste in the ultimate, is free from the superimpositions of the two‚Äîdifferent and not different, apprehended and apprehender, eternal and annihilated‚Äîbecause it is essenceless.

original: bral ba'i dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga ni ji srid nam mkha'i bar du gnas te /
analyzed: bral ba'i dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi phung po lnga ni ji srid nam mkha'i bar du gnas te /
translated: The five aggregates of the pure state remain as long as space endures.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob pa gang zhig thabs la mkhas pas 'khor ba kun tu mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas dbu ma'i lam la gnas pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob pa gang zhig thabs la mkhas pas 'khor ba kun tu mthong nas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has attained power, who is endowed with the avoidance of the two extremes and the abiding in the middle way, who sees the entire world through skill in means,

original: de 'khor ba 'di yongs su mi gtong la /
analyzed: de 'khor ba 'di yongs su mi gtong la /
translated: does not abandon the world.

original: gang stong pa nyid du yang nye bar mi dmigs pa la rab tu gnas pa nyid de de ni 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid du yang nye bar mi dmigs pa la rab tu gnas pa nyid de de ni 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: And he does not abandon nirvana, since he abides in the non-apprehension of emptiness.

original: gsol pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: gsol pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid ji ltar 'dod /
translated: He asks: How is the characteristic of the non-residual considered to be due to the absence of conceptual differentiation?

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad gang yang de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang gang yang de rnams kyi de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis dang / gang yang spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad gang yang de rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang gang yang de rnams kyi de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis dang / gang yang spros pa med pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the non-residual is due to the absence of conceptual differentiation in regard to all things such as form, etc. and their emptiness, and also in regard to both existence and non-existence, and also in regard to the absence of mental fabrication.

original: 'di rnams su rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid do//
analyzed: 'di rnams su rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ma lus pa'i mtshan nyid do//
translated: These are the characteristics of the non-residual.

original: @211b rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: @211b rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti asked,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la ji ltar las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag ces pa la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la ji ltar las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag ces pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúHow are actions and results established in phenomena that are essentially not real things?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: chos rnams thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma shes nas /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma shes nas /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen all phenomena are not understood to be essentially not real things,üîΩsentient beings create actions through thoughts that are motivated by error.

original: sems can rnams phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis las byas pas ji ltar las kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams phyin ci log gis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis las byas pas ji ltar las kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: How do they obtain the results of actions?

original: de la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang gzhan gyi phyin ci ma log bzhi ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang gzhan gyi phyin ci ma log bzhi ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la /
translated: Regarding this, the four errors of permanence, happiness, self, and other are the factors that are incompatible with the selflessness of persons.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes pa ni phyin ci log spang ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes pa ni phyin ci log spang ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: The clinging to real things is the factor that is incompatible with the selflessness of phenomena.‚Äù This is the enlightened activity of establishing the abandonment of error.

original: phyin ci log gi sems can rnams las mngon par 'du byed la des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ni tha snyad du las dang don dam par ma yin no //üîΩdngos po skra'i rtse mo bye bar gshegs pa'i cha shas tsam cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la gang la gnas pa nyid kyis las byed pa de ni ji ltar rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa ni phyin ci log dang dngos po
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sems can rnams las mngon par 'du byed la des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ni tha snyad du las dang don dam par ma yin no // dngos po skra'i rtse mo bye bar gshegs pa'i cha shas tsam cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin la gang la gnas pa nyid kyis las byed pa de ni ji ltar rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin zhes pa ni phyin ci log dang dngos po
translated: The karma that is accumulated by sentient beings who are mistaken is, conventionally, the thoroughly afflictive karma, not ultimately.

original: med pa nyid du shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: med pa nyid du shes pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: There is not even the slightest existent thing that is a part of a tip of a hair divided into a hundred parts. That which is the basis of karma is like a dream, an illusion, and so forth. This is the activity of establishing the understanding of the nonexistence of mistaken things and existent things.

original: gang chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad du byed kyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang mya ngan las 'das pa la de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad du byed kyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: That which is the sameness of phenomena, suchness, the perfect end, and nirvana is also conventionally designated by the conventions of the world, but not ultimately,

original: brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: because it is inexpressible. This is the activity of establishing purification.

original: gal te yang chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu ste dngos po med pa de ltar na yang de ma shes nas sems can rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen pas las byas nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu ste dngos po med pa de ltar na yang de ma shes nas sems can rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen pas las byas nas bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even though all phenomena are like a dream and are not real things, sentient beings do not understand this and, due to their attachment to real things, they create karma and go to happy or bad rebirths.

original: de rnams kyi phyin ci log spong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la spyod pa de srid du mngon par byang chub pa'i bar du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la 'god pa'i phrin las so ;
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyin ci log spong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la spyod pa de srid du mngon par byang chub pa'i bar du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes pa ni rnam par byang ba'i tshogs la 'god pa'i phrin las so ;
translated: In order to eliminate their misconceptions, bodhisattvas engage in the accumulations and bring sentient beings to full maturity until they attain manifest enlightenment. This is the enlightened activity of establishing beings in the accumulation of complete purification.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'di dag nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThese are the realizations.

original: gang du gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i spros pa med pa'i chos mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang du gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i spros pa med pa'i chos mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: In the equality of phenomena, which is free from the elaborations of duality and nonduality,

original: de nyid chos thams cad la de nyid so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la /
analyzed: de nyid chos thams cad la de nyid so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams la /
translated: that itself is present in all phenomena, in ordinary beings and in the persons who are ƒÅryas.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang @212a * //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang @212a * //
translated: That itself is the Jewel of the Buddha,

original: chos dkon mchog dang dge 'dun dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog dang dge 'dun dkon mchog ste /
translated: the Jewel of the Dharma, and the Jewel of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir chos nyid la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir chos nyid la /
translated: Because of sameness,

original: chos nyid la ni tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid la ni tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: in reality there is no difference in reality.

original: de ni 'dus byas ma yin la 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin te /üîΩgang 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas gnyi gar ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas ma yin la 'dus ma byas pa yang ma yin te / gang 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas gnyi gar ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not conditioned, nor is it unconditioned.üîΩIt is not both conditioned and unconditioned,üîΩnor is it neither.

original: mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa tha mi dad do //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa tha mi dad do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the unconditioned.

original: mi shes pa la 'god pa'i 'phrin las so //
analyzed: mi shes pa la 'god pa'i 'phrin las so //
translated: Its activity is to establish the ignorant.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma mdzad pa ste /
translated: That is not created by the TathƒÅgatas,

original: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid des dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mchog tu brtags nas zad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
analyzed: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid des dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mchog tu brtags nas zad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa'i phrin las so //
translated: And also, by that emptiness of intrinsic reality, having imagined the supreme of things and non-things, the exhaustion is nirvana. This is the activity of establishing in nirvana.

original: mdzad pa khyab pa nyid du bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mdzad pa khyab pa nyid du bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: In order to teach the pervasion of activity, he said:

original: chos thams cad la 'khrug pa med pa nyid pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'khrug pa med pa nyid pas zhes pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are without disturbance.

original: mdzad pa'i kun tu spyod pas so //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i kun tu spyod pas so //
translated: By the conduct of activity.

original: chos thams cad ni phrin las kyi mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te de 'khrug pa med pa nyid ni gnod byed med pa nyid de des shes nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis ji
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phrin las kyi mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te de 'khrug pa med pa nyid ni gnod byed med pa nyid de des shes nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis ji
translated: All phenomena are the twenty-seven activities. Their absence of disturbance is the absence of harm. By knowing that, in all aspects, to all sentient beings dwelling in the worlds of the ten directions, the bodhisattva's activity is uninterrupted.

original: ltar snod la rgyun chad pa med pas nam mkha' ji srid bar du rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'khrug pa med pa nyid de de 'dra ba can du rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gsungs pa ni
analyzed: ltar snod la rgyun chad pa med pas nam mkha' ji srid bar du rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'khrug pa med pa nyid de de 'dra ba can du rtogs par bya'o zhes pas gsungs pa ni
translated: Since the vessel is uninterrupted in this way, it is engaged for as long as space exists. Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is without disturbance. It should be understood to be like that.‚Äù

original: chos kyi sku'i mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mdzad pa'o //
translated: This is the activity of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid phas kyi ngag la sogs pa rnams ni 'khrug pa med pa'i ngag gi mthar thug pa la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho mu med pa nyid phas kyi ngag la sogs pa rnams ni 'khrug pa med pa'i ngag gi mthar thug pa la /
translated: The ‚Äúunbounded ocean‚Äù and so on are the ultimate of the speech that is without disturbance.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni khyad par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhes pa ni khyad par gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is a special statement.

original: de rnams don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthar gyis bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthar gyis bstan par 'dod nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Desiring to teach the ultimate nature of those, he said,

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir rgya mtsho ni mu med pa nyid la de ltar phung po lnga rnams rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgya mtsho ni mu med pa nyid la de ltar phung po lnga rnams rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Here, the ‚Äúunbounded ocean‚Äù is the unbounded nature of the five aggregates, which are like an ocean.

original: de bzhin du phung po'i nang du son pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ji srid de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po'i nang du son pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa ji srid de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom that is included in the aggregates, and because of which form, etc., are all empty,

original: de nas ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin te mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de nas ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin te mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: is neither conjoined nor disjoined, is of one mark,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes pa la sogs @212b pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'o zhes pa la sogs @212b pa'o //
translated: this, namely, the absence of marks.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sogs pa la yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sogs pa la yang shes par bya ste /
translated: And likewise, it should be understood as being like space, etc.,

original: ji srid du mi dmigs pa'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du mi dmigs pa'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: up to the point where it is not apprehended.

original: 'khrug pa med pa ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Non-agitation is non-understanding.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rgyas par bstan pa de ltar 'dir rjes su tshor bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rgyas par bstan pa de ltar 'dir rjes su tshor bar bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, as the eight realizations along with their retinue have been extensively taught according to desire, thus here they are to be experientially cultivated.

original: rjes su rig par byed pa ni yi ge'i tshogs kyis mnyan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig par byed pa ni yi ge'i tshogs kyis mnyan par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who makes them known is the one who causes them to be heard with the collection of letters.

original: rnam par dpyod par byed pa ni don gyi khog gis shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod par byed pa ni don gyi khog gis shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The investigator is the one who understands the essence of the meaning.

original: 'jug pa ni dang bar byed pa'o //üîΩrtogs par byed pa ni rab tu shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni dang bar byed pa'o // rtogs par byed pa ni rab tu shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The engager is the one who has faith.üîΩThe realizer is the one who has full understanding.

original: sems pa ni rig pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni rig pa rnams kyis rnam par brtags par byed pa'o //
translated: The thinker is the one who analyzes with awareness.

original: 'jal ba ni de lta bu nyid des gnod pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'jal ba ni de lta bu nyid des gnod pa med ces pa ste /
translated: The measurer is the one who is not harmed by that suchness.

original: gang du gnas pa la byis pa nus pa zad nas dub nas myos pa dang brgyal ba 'am 'chi bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang du gnas pa la byis pa nus pa zad nas dub nas myos pa dang brgyal ba 'am 'chi bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Where the child, having exhausted his ability, becomes tired, confused, or dies,

original: de la gnas nas gzhan du sems pas de rnams la 'jal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas nas gzhan du sems pas de rnams la 'jal bar byed pa'o //
translated: dwelling there, thinking otherwise, he measures those [things].

original: ji ltar 'di rnams ni bcom ldan 'das mchog tu rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis gzigs pa de ltar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rnams ni bcom ldan 'das mchog tu rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug gis gzigs pa de ltar bstan pa ste /
translated: As these [things] are seen by the Blessed One, the Lord of Supreme Yoga, so they are taught.

original: bdag cag gis 'di las gzhan du mi bsam ste /
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di las gzhan du mi bsam ste /
translated: We should not think of them otherwise,

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: because they are not the domain of speculation.

original: nye bar rtog pa ni 'di rnams la de ltar thams cad gcod pa'i phyir 'di lta bu nyid kyis kun du rtog par byed pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa ni 'di rnams la de ltar thams cad gcod pa'i phyir 'di lta bu nyid kyis kun du rtog par byed pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Thorough investigation is the investigation of all these as just that, in order to cut through them all.

original: de ltar shin tu the tshom chod nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu the tshom chod nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, having cut through doubts, there are four kinds of meditation:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / zhi gnas lhag mthong la mngon par dga' bas so //
translated: calm abiding, insight, delight in calm abiding and insight, and delight in equanimity.

original: ji lta bar yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bar yid la byed ce na /
translated: How does one attend to them?

original: gsungs pa ni rgyu thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni rgyu thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúAll causes‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: bdag ces pa dang / bdag gi zhes pa dang / gzugs zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad kyi spros pa la mngon par zhen pas yid la byed pa thams cad ni rab tu smra ba rnams dang bdud rnams dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyod pa'o
analyzed: bdag ces pa dang / bdag gi zhes pa dang / gzugs zhes pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa'i bar zhes pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad kyi spros pa la mngon par zhen pas yid la byed pa thams cad ni rab tu smra ba rnams dang bdud rnams dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bskyod pa'o
translated: All mental engagements, such as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù ‚Äúform‚Äù up to ‚Äúconsciousness,‚Äù and so forth, are shaken by the proponents of views, demons, and afflictions.

original: // yon tan thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: // yon tan thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
translated: All qualities are those of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyis rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught in detail through eight realizations,üîΩthe brief indication is as follows.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states:üîΩThe characteristics, its application,üîΩits peak, its sequence,

original: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //üîΩdon bsdus @213a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go rims dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni // don bsdus @213a * //
translated: its culmination, and its full ripening,

original: gzhan de rnam pa drug / ces te /
analyzed: gzhan de rnam pa drug / ces te /
translated: are the six aspects of the summary.

original: yang na mdo'i don rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: yang na mdo'i don rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Or, the meaning of the sutra is in six aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / gsum de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa ni 'di la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩrtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i rab kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / gsum de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid la rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa ni 'di la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o // rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i rab kyi'o //
translated: The three - omniscience, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all aspects - are the characteristics of the perfection of wisdom. The complete realization of all aspects is the application of this.üîΩThe peak realization is the peak of this application.

original: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i go rims so //
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i go rims so //
translated: The serial realization is the sequence of this application.

original: skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa ni sbyor ba 'di'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The culmination of this practice is the realization in a single moment.

original: chos kyi sku ni 'di'i rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni 'di'i rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The Dharma Body is its evolutionary development.

original: yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states:

original: rnam pa gsum ni yul gyi rgyu //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni yul gyi rgyu //
translated: The three aspects are the cause of the object,

original: sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
translated: the fourfold practice, the Dharma Body, and the evolutionary development.

original: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: gzhan du don bsdus rnam pa gsum //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the other chapters is threefold.

original: zhes te / yang na mdo'i don ni gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes te / yang na mdo'i don ni gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is threefold:

original: rgyu dang / sbyor ba dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang / sbyor ba dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: cause, practice, and result.

original: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu'i yul ni kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum la /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i rgyu'i yul ni kun mkhyen pa rnam pa gsum la /
translated: The cause of the practice is the three knowledges.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The practice is fourfold,

original: sbyor ba spyi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba spyi'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the general practice.

original: rgyu'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku dang phrin las so //
analyzed: rgyu'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku dang phrin las so //
translated: The result of the cause is the Dharma Body and its evolutionary development.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i rtag par rab tu ngu ba la sogs pa'i le'u gsum ni /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i rtag par rab tu ngu ba la sogs pa'i le'u gsum ni /
translated: The other three chapters, beginning with the chapter on the constant weeping of Sadaprarudita,

original: go sla ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'u byas pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: go sla ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi tshig le'u byas pas ma bshad do //
translated: are not explained in the verse-commentary on the Ornament of Clear Realization, because they are easy to understand.

original: rjes su rig pa'i brjod pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: rjes su rig pa'i brjod pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the subsequent knowledge.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las rjes su rig pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi zla ba'i 'od ces bya ba pandi ta chen po 'jigs med 'byung gnas sbas pas mdzad pa las rjes su rig pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'o /
translated: This completes the chapter on the subsequent knowledge, the twenty-ninth chapter of the Great Sage's Light of the Moon, a commentary on the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines, composed by the great pandit Abhayakaragupta.

original: // / ji ltar bcom ldan 'das ma nyid btsal bar bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par bshad pa gsungs pa ni /üîΩgzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / ji ltar bcom ldan 'das ma nyid btsal bar bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par bshad pa gsungs pa ni / gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of how the Blessed Lady herself is to be sought is stated beginning with Moreover...

original: rtag par rab tu du ba ni de la tshogs kyi sa la gnas pa chos kyi rgyun gyis sangs rgyas rnams la gdams ngag thob pa ste /
analyzed: rtag par rab tu du ba ni de la tshogs kyi sa la gnas pa chos kyi rgyun gyis sangs rgyas rnams la gdams ngag thob pa ste /
translated: Constantly grieving means that one who abides on the stage of accumulation, by the stream of Dharma, obtains instructions from the Buddhas.

original: de ltar ni sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de ltar ni sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug go //
translated: In this way, one becomes a lord of the tenth stage.

original: lus ngal ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa rnams dgag pa ni shin tu brtson 'grus che ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus ngal ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa rnams dgag pa ni shin tu brtson 'grus che ba'i don to //
translated: The negation of mental engagements such as bodily fatigue has the meaning of being extremely diligent.

original: gang la yang smon par mi byed ces pa la sogs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa ste /
analyzed: gang la yang smon par mi byed ces pa la sogs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba dgag pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning one should not aspire to anything at all is the prohibition against distraction.

original: smon par mi byed pa ni zhen par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: smon par mi byed pa ni zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not aspiring means not clinging.

original: g-yon phyogs nas dang de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid ni ma yin pa yid la @213b byed pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs nas dang de bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pas ni de kho na nyid ni ma yin pa yid la @213b byed pa dgag pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning from the left and likewise from the right is the prohibition against attending to what is not reality.

original: bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las ma g-yos zhes pa ni 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa la /
analyzed: bdag las ma g-yos shing 'jig tshogs las ma g-yos zhes pa ni 'jig par 'gyur bas 'jig pa la /
translated: Not moving from the self means not moving from the perishable.

original: bsags pas tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsags pas tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perishable is a collection because it is an accumulation.

original: mi rtag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'jig tshogs te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni 'jig tshogs te /
translated: Impermanent form, etc. are the perishable.

original: 'jig tshogs ni gang zag tu brtags pa la ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ni gang zag tu brtags pa la ste /
translated: The perishable is the imputation of a person.

original: 'dir gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i tshul gyis ma g-yos pa dang btags par yod pas kyang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i tshul gyis ma g-yos pa dang btags par yod pas kyang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Here, one should not move in the manner of substantial existence of the person, nor even in the manner of imputed existence.

original: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are not perceived.

original: gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs las kyang ma g-yos pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning not moving from form is the prohibition against attending to the aggregates.

original: chos rnams thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are also unobservable.

original: 'dir 'di rnams kyis 'di rnams su sgro btags nas g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di rnams kyis 'di rnams su sgro btags nas g-yo ba'o //
translated: Here, they are imputed as these and those, and then they move.

original: rnam par byang ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Purification is non-returning.

original: snang ba ni thar pa'i lam ston pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: snang ba ni thar pa'i lam ston pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Illumination is by those who teach the path of liberation.

original: mos pa'i sems 'di nyid kyis de ltar zhes pa ni kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa'i sems 'di nyid kyis de ltar zhes pa ni kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: This very mind of aspiration is thus conceptualization.

original: mtshan ma yongs su spangs pa zhes pa ni bstan pa la /
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su spangs pa zhes pa ni bstan pa la /
translated: Abandoning signs is the teaching.

original: bshad pa ni dngos po zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni dngos po zhes pa ste /
translated: The explanation is things.

original: dngos po ni chos su lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la ngo bo nyid med pa ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni chos su lta ba dang / sems can du lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la ngo bo nyid med pa ni skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Things are the view of phenomena, the view of sentient beings, and the view of self.

original: gang la yang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de la dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la yang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de la dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Where there is no arising and no ceasing, there are no things.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'o zhes ston par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la de las bzlog pa ston pa ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'o zhes ston par byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la de las bzlog pa ston pa ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who teaches non-things is a spiritual friend. The opposite of that is a bad friend.

original: bsgrub par byas nas te rjes su gnas na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par byas nas te rjes su gnas na'o //
translated: Having practiced, that is, having subsequently abided.

original: byas pa shes pa ni thos pa shes pas so //
analyzed: byas pa shes pa ni thos pa shes pas so //
translated: Knowing what is done is through knowing what is heard.

original: byas pa tshor ba ni thos pa'i 'bras bu shes pas so //
analyzed: byas pa tshor ba ni thos pa'i 'bras bu shes pas so //
translated: Feeling what is done is through knowing the result of hearing.

original: yongs su rtogs la zhes pa ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs la zhes pa ni bsam pa'o //
translated: Having fully understood is reflection.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing ni gos sar pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing ni gos sar pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mundane material things are new clothes and so on.

original: bsten par zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas longs spyod par ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsten par zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas longs spyod par ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The three phrases beginning with ‚Äúserving‚Äù are for the small, medium and great, with the meaning of ‚Äúenjoying‚Äù.

original: zil gyis mnan pa skyon can du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan pa skyon can du byed pa'o //
translated: Overpowering is making it faulty.

original: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir ni sems can rnams kyi sems bsrung ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i phyir ni sems can rnams kyi sems bsrung ba'i don to //
translated: For the sake of taming sentient beings is for the sake of protecting the minds of sentient beings.

original: yongs su bzung ba nye bar gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su gzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba nye bar gzung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni yongs su gzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of appropriation is for the sake of grasping.

original: chags pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Attachment is craving.

original: dmigs pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Observation is close observation.

original: kun rdzob la gnas pa'i thabs nye bar bstan nas don dam pa la gnas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob la gnas pa'i thabs nye bar bstan nas don dam pa la gnas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having taught the means of abiding in the conventional, he then taught abiding in the ultimate:

original: de'i skad cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: de'i skad cig ces pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that instant‚Äù means

original: dge slong ni 'phags pa chos 'phags te /
analyzed: dge slong ni 'phags pa chos 'phags te /
translated: the monk was the noble Dharmodgata,

original: bud med drug khri brgyad stong dang @214a * //
analyzed: bud med drug khri brgyad stong dang @214a * //
translated: who together with 68,000 women

original: lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rgyun ma chad par rol pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rgyun ma chad par rol pa ste /
translated: continuously enjoyed the five sense objects,

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang / ro dang reg bya rnams so //
translated: namely form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de nyid ma thob na 'dod par byed cing dga' bar byed pas na 'dod pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ma thob na 'dod par byed cing dga' bar byed pas na 'dod pa la /
translated: Since one desires and delights in them when one has not attained reality, they are sense objects.

original: thob nas yon tan du byed cing yang nas yang du longs spyod pas na yon tan te ;
analyzed: thob nas yon tan du byed cing yang nas yang du longs spyod pas na yon tan te ;
translated: Since one enjoys them again and again, considering them to be good qualities when one has attained them, they are good qualities.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan dang yang dag pa'i tshul ni don dam pa'i rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan dang yang dag pa'i tshul ni don dam pa'i rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: The five sense objects and the correct method are the ultimate discrimination.

original: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga rnams la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po lnga rnams la /
translated: All phenomena are the five aggregates.

original: sems can med pa la sogs pas ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa la sogs pas ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pas ni chos la bdag med pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of sentient beings and so on refers to the selflessness of persons, and the illusion-like and so on refers to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: yid mi skyo ba ni lo bdun du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid mi skyo ba ni lo bdun du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The absence of mental weariness is due to his seven years of meditative equipoise in absorption.

original: sgra de las zhes pa ni so sor sgrogs pa'i tshig la ste /
analyzed: sgra de las zhes pa ni so sor sgrogs pa'i tshig la ste /
translated: The words from that sound refer to the words of the individual proclamations.

original: skyo ba med pa ni dub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa ni dub pa med pa'o //
translated: Absence of weariness is absence of fatigue.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni gdams pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni gdams pa'o //
translated: Instruction is advice.

original: tshogs kyis pa la mngon par shes pa dam pa med kyang 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis so //
analyzed: tshogs kyis pa la mngon par shes pa dam pa med kyang 'phags pa chos 'phags kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis so //
translated: Although he does not have the highest superknowledge of the aggregate of learning, through the blessing of the noble Dharmodgata.

original: mthong ba'i nus pa dang bral nas smras pa ni yongs su ma mthong zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i nus pa dang bral nas smras pa ni yongs su ma mthong zhes pa'o //
translated: Having lost the ability to see, he said, I have not seen.

original: ngu ba ni 'chi ma 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: ngu ba ni 'chi ma 'dzag pa'o //
translated: Crying is the shedding of tears.

original: cho nge ni dbyangs kyis so //
analyzed: cho nge ni dbyangs kyis so //
translated: Lamenting is with sound.

original: mya ngan ni gdung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan ni gdung bar byed pas so //
translated: Sorrow is the torment.

original: smre sngags ni brjod pas so //
analyzed: smre sngags ni brjod pas so //
translated: Moaning is the expression.

original: rjes su 'brel pa ni kun du ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa ni kun du ldan pa'o //
translated: Connection is association.

original: rjes su 'brel par 'gyur pa'i tshig yod kyang de nyid do ;
analyzed: rjes su 'brel par 'gyur pa'i tshig yod kyang de nyid do ;
translated: Although the words ‚Äúin relation to‚Äù are not explicitly stated, they are understood.

original: / bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: / bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSurrounded‚Äù means completely surrounded.

original: 'obs ni 'obs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: 'obs ni 'obs su bskor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMoat‚Äù means surrounded by a moat.

original: 'byor pa ni nor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni nor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWealth‚Äù means abundant wealth.

original: rgyas pa ni khang pa la skyed mos tshal la sogs pas mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni khang pa la skyed mos tshal la sogs pas mdzes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúProsperous‚Äù means beautiful with houses, gardens, and so on.

original: bde ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHappy‚Äù means free from violence.

original: lo legs pa ni bza' ba dang btung ba rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo legs pa ni bza' ba dang btung ba rnyed par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGood harvest‚Äù means food and drink are easily obtained.

original: yangs pa ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: yangs pa ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpacious‚Äù means vast.

original: mang po ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: mang po ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMany‚Äù means various kinds of people.

original: 'khor gang dag de la de ltar de dang 'dra ba'i mi rnams kyang gang gis de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor gang dag de la de ltar de dang 'dra ba'i mi rnams kyang gang gis de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAssembly‚Äù means those who gather there.

original: bar ni nang la tshong khang ni nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas te der khyams lnga brgya rnams su ma lus pa bkram pa'o //
analyzed: bar ni nang la tshong khang ni nyo tshong byed pa'i gnas te der khyams lnga brgya rnams su ma lus pa bkram pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the middle‚Äù means inside. ‚ÄúMarket‚Äù means a place for buying and selling. There, five hundred courtyards are spread out without exception.

original: khyams rnams kyi ra ba'i bar du gnyi ga gnas byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyams rnams kyi ra ba'i bar du gnyi ga gnas byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Between the courtyards, there are two kinds of abodes.

original: ri mo sna tshogs su bris pa ni de la sna tshogs pas rmad du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri mo sna tshogs su bris pa ni de la sna tshogs pas rmad du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is painted with various pictures, because it is wonderful with its various colors.

original: lta bu ni grong dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bu ni grong dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a city, because it is in conformity with a city.

original: 'dzer dogs med pa ni kun du gnod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzer dogs med pa ni kun du gnod pa med pa ste /
translated: It is without fear, because it is without danger.

original: skye bo'i khyogs khri'i gzhon pa rnams kyi rkang gis 'gro ba rnams kyis 'ong ba'i @214b gnas dang / kun du 'gro ba'i gnas rnams kyi srang bar yangs pa der de rnams kyis gnas par byed pas legs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo'i khyogs khri'i gzhon pa rnams kyi rkang gis 'gro ba rnams kyis 'ong ba'i @214b gnas dang / kun du 'gro ba'i gnas rnams kyi srang bar yangs pa der de rnams kyis gnas par byed pas legs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is well-made, because it is the place where the people of the city, who are the young of the palanquin, go and come, and it is the broad street of the places of assembly.

original: khyogs khri ni bzung nas bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: khyogs khri ni bzung nas bgrod pa'o //
translated: A palanquin is a conveyance carried by two or more men.

original: bzhon pa ni shing rta'o //
analyzed: bzhon pa ni shing rta'o //
translated: A vehicle is a chariot.

original: mthon dman med pa'i phyir phan tshun 'dra ba'i phyir na mtshungs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mthon dman med pa'i phyir phan tshun 'dra ba'i phyir na mtshungs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is even, because it is the same everywhere, since it is without high and low.

original: zlum po'i mda' yab ste /
analyzed: zlum po'i mda' yab ste /
translated: It is a circular terrace,

original: ra ba las cung zhig mtho bar son pa'o //
analyzed: ra ba las cung zhig mtho bar son pa'o //
translated: which is slightly higher than the wall.

original: zlum po las shing bzung ba las thams cad 'dir yod pas thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zlum po las shing bzung ba las thams cad 'dir yod pas thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is complete, because it is all here, since it is a support for the trees on the circular terrace.

original: dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba ni rin po che'i phreng bas sbrel bas mnga' yab kyi shing la sbrel ba'i rin po che'i chun 'phyangs du mas 'phyang ngo //
analyzed: dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba ni rin po che'i phreng bas sbrel bas mnga' yab kyi shing la sbrel ba'i rin po che'i chun 'phyangs du mas 'phyang ngo //
translated: The network of small bells is connected by strings of jewels, and it is hung with many jeweled curtains connected to the wish-fulfilling trees.

original: snyan pa ni sgra thos nas bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pa ni sgra thos nas bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant, because one hears sounds and is happy.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni sems bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni sems bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Delightful, because the mind is happy.

original: 'jam pa ni yid 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni yid 'phrog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Soft, because it captivates the mind.

original: yan lag lnga ni pi wang dang gling bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni pi wang dang gling bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five branches are the lute, flute, and so on.

original: rol mo mkhan ni dri za'i gar glu mkhan gyis so //
analyzed: rol mo mkhan ni dri za'i gar glu mkhan gyis so //
translated: The musicians are the gandharvas, who sing and dance.

original: rtse dga' ba ni thos pas so //
analyzed: rtse dga' ba ni thos pas so //
translated: They play, because they hear.

original: dga' mgu ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: dga' mgu ni yid kyis so //
translated: They are delighted, because they are mentally happy.

original: yongs su spyod pa ni lus dang ngag yongs su dga' bas so //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa ni lus dang ngag yongs su dga' bas so //
translated: They enjoy themselves, because their bodies and speech are happy.

original: rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni klung la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pas chu 'bab pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmngon par skyes pa ni mngon par skyes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa zhes pa ni klung la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pas chu 'bab pa dang ldan pa'o // mngon par skyes pa ni mngon par skyes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: In harmony means that the water flows in harmony with the rivers and so on.üîΩIt is born means that it is born from the trees.

original: gya nom pa ni gya nom pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gya nom pa ni gya nom pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is excellent means that it is excellent for the gods.

original: chu zhing ni zlum pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: chu zhing ni zlum pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The water-field is round.

original: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa ste //
analyzed: sngon po zhes pa la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa ste //
translated: The blue, etc., are the brief indication.

original: sngon po dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir kha dog sngon po'o //üîΩkun du sbyor ba las byung ba'i phyir sngon po lta bur ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir kha dog sngon po'o // kun du sbyor ba las byung ba'i phyir sngon po lta bur ston pa'o //
translated: Because it is born together with the blue, it is blue-colored.üîΩBecause it arises from the blue, it is blue-appearing.

original: gnyi ga'i 'od kyis sprul pas mig lam du gsal ba'i phyir 'od sngon po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i 'od kyis sprul pas mig lam du gsal ba'i phyir 'od sngon po 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because it is manifested in the visual field by the light of both, it is blue-light-emitting.

original: de bzhin du ser po la zhes pa la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po la zhes pa la sogs pa la yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for yellow, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de la ri mor byed pa ni de la mchog tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de la ri mor byed pa ni de la mchog tu dang ba'o //
translated: The Buddha's way is the perfection of wisdom. One who makes a picture of it has supreme faith in it.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni legs su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni legs su 'gro bas so //
translated: The progression is the good progression.

original: thos pa ni gang rnams kyis so //
analyzed: thos pa ni gang rnams kyis so //
translated: Those who hear it are the hearers.

original: dbus kyi bzhi mdo ni mngon par mtshon par bya ba'i gnas kyi'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi bzhi mdo ni mngon par mtshon par bya ba'i gnas kyi'o //
translated: The central crossroads is the place to be manifested.

original: khor yug ni so sor logs kyi'o //
analyzed: khor yug ni so sor logs kyi'o //
translated: The surrounding area is the individual sides.

original: khang pa'i longs spyod ni khang pa'i yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: khang pa'i longs spyod ni khang pa'i yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the house is the complete surrounding of the house.

original: nye bar spyod pa ni me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni me tog dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is flowers, fruits, and so on.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa ni ma lus pa'i nags dang gnas la sogs pa'o //üîΩbar ni mtshams so //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa ni ma lus pa'i nags dang gnas la sogs pa'o // bar ni mtshams so //
translated: The full enjoyment is the forest, the place, and so on, without exception.üîΩThe interval is the boundary.

original: de bar ni skabs so //üîΩdbang du gyur pa ni yang dag @215a * //
analyzed: de bar ni skabs so // dbang du gyur pa ni yang dag @215a * //
translated: The interval is the space.

original: par 'du ba ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de rnams kyis dbang po thams cad rjes su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: par 'du ba ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de rnams kyis dbang po thams cad rjes su bzung ba'o //
translated: The mastery is the gathering, the possession of all the faculties by means of those five objects of desire.

original: ldan pa ni de dang sbyor bas ldan pa can no //
analyzed: ldan pa ni de dang sbyor bas ldan pa can no //
translated: The possession is the possession by the connection with them.

original: rtse ba ni ngag gis so //
analyzed: rtse ba ni ngag gis so //
translated: The play is with the voice.

original: dga' ba ni yid kyis so //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid kyis so //
translated: The joy is with the mind.

original: dga' dgur spyod pa ni lus kyis so //
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod pa ni lus kyis so //
translated: The enjoyment is with the body.

original: de srid du ni dpag tu med pa'i dus nas so //
analyzed: de srid du ni dpag tu med pa'i dus nas so //
translated: For that long is from the immeasurable time.

original: bstan pas mtshams ni zla ba'i bye brag khyad par du gyur pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: bstan pas mtshams ni zla ba'i bye brag khyad par du gyur pa'i rigs so //
translated: The indication is the boundary. The moon is the special type.

original: steng snying po can ni rgya nag po'i dar te gdan de'i steng du 'di bting ba'o //
analyzed: steng snying po can ni rgya nag po'i dar te gdan de'i steng du 'di bting ba'o //
translated: The upper essence is the Chinese silk. The seat is spread on that seat.

original: shing bal gyis bkang ba'i sngas zhes pa yang gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: shing bal gyis bkang ba'i sngas zhes pa yang gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: The pillows filled with cotton are also of others.

original: ka shi ka'i gos ni b'a r'a na s'i'i gos bzang po bting ba'o //
analyzed: ka shi ka'i gos ni b'a r'a na s'i'i gos bzang po bting ba'o //
translated: The cloth of Kasi is the excellent cloth of Varanasi that is spread out.

original: dga' pa ni sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dga' pa ni sems rtse gcig tu gnas par gyur ba'o //
translated: Delight is the mind that abides one-pointedly.

original: mu tig ces pa ni dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa rnams 'phyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu tig ces pa ni dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa rnams 'phyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The pearls are the hanging nets and half-nets.

original: mngon par gtor ba ni bkram pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gtor ba ni bkram pa'o //
translated: Scattered means spread out.

original: rab tu gtor ba ni logs gsum du'o //
analyzed: rab tu gtor ba ni logs gsum du'o //
translated: Scattered well means on three sides.

original: kun du rab tu gtor ba ni logs bzhi kar ro //
analyzed: kun du rab tu gtor ba ni logs bzhi kar ro //
translated: Scattered everywhere means on all four sides.

original: chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni chos la dad pa dang 'dun pa dag rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bsam pa rnam par dag pa ni chos la dad pa dang 'dun pa dag rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Pure intention towards the Dharma is the purity of faith and aspiration for the Dharma.

original: chos la gus pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la gus pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi phyir ro //
translated: Respect for the Dharma is for the sake of the spiritual friend.

original: bsten pa ni skal pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsten pa ni skal pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Attending is having good fortune.

original: log par mi ltung ba ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: log par mi ltung ba ni ngan 'gror mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: Not falling into error is not going to the lower realms.

original: rgyun ma chad pa ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
analyzed: rgyun ma chad pa ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
translated: Without interruption is without break.

original: dga' ba ni tshim pa la mgu ba ni dga' ba chen po sngon du 'gro ba'o /
analyzed: dga' ba ni tshim pa la mgu ba ni dga' ba chen po sngon du 'gro ba'o /
translated: Joy is satisfaction, and delight is the antecedent of great joy.

original: de gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yid rang ba'o //
analyzed: de gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yid rang ba'o //
translated: Because of their oneness, there is mental ease.

original: dga' bar mthar thug pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bar mthar thug pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The culmination of joy is rapture.

original: dga' ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni dang ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang lhan cig par gyur pa ni dang ba'o //
translated: The state of being together with joy is faith.

original: dga' ba dang yid bde pa ni 'di las de skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang yid bde pa ni 'di las de skyes pa'o //
translated: Joy and mental pleasure are born from this.

original: de'i zhes pa ni de las so //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa ni de las so //
translated: The word his refers to the bodhisattva.

original: rgyu la mi gnas pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu la mi gnas pa ste ma skyes pa'o //
translated: He does not stand in the cause, that is, he is not born.

original: chos thams cad ces pa ni 'du shes shin tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces pa ni 'du shes shin tu mnyam par gzhag pas so //
translated: All dharmas means that he is well equipoised in ideation.

original: de'i mthu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs chen po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthu'i ting nge 'dzin ni de ltar mngon sum du byed pa'i thabs chen po'i phyir ro //
translated: His power samadhi is the great means for realizing that.

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la rnam par lta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is as follows: he views the reality nature of all dharmas, and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la blta ba med pa'i sbyor bas rnam par blta ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de la blta ba med pa'i sbyor bas rnam par blta ba'o //
translated: The reality nature of all dharmas is ultimately their realitylessness. He views that by the application of nonviewing.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-apprehension of the intrinsic reality of all things is because the intrinsic reality of all things is ultimately non-apprehensible.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa las nges par 'byung ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par yod pa la sogs pa'i sgro @215b btags pa de'i shes pas mngon par shes pas mngon par zhen pa de la log pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid shes pa las nges par 'byung ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid don dam par yod pa la sogs pa'i sgro @215b btags pa de'i shes pas mngon par shes pas mngon par zhen pa de la log pa'o //
translated: The deliverance from the knowledge of the intrinsic reality of all things is the reversal of that knowledge and the over-estimation of it, by means of the super-knowledge of the non-existence of the intrinsic reality of all things ultimately.

original: gzhung kha cig tu ni chos thams cad mi shes pa las nges par 'byung ngo zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig tu ni chos thams cad mi shes pa las nges par 'byung ngo zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: In some texts, it is also said: ‚ÄúThe deliverance from the non-knowledge of all things.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa nyid ni chos thams cad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa med pa nyid ni chos thams cad med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-differentiation of all things is because all things are non-existent.

original: gang zhig mnyam par bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mnyam par bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: It is in regard to that which is to be accomplished equally.

original: chos thams cad la 'gyur ba med par mthong ba ni chos thams cad tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phri ba dang bsnan pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'gyur ba med par mthong ba ni chos thams cad tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phri ba dang bsnan pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seeing of all things as unchanging is because all things are without the subtraction or addition of differentiation, etc.

original: chos thams cad kun du snang bar byed pa ni chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i kun rdzob rnams de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kun du snang bar byed pa ni chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i kun rdzob rnams de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It illuminates all phenomena because it sees the correct conventionalities of all phenomena as being of one taste with suchness.

original: chos thams cad mun pa dang bral ba ni chos rnams thams cad ma rig pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mun pa dang bral ba ni chos rnams thams cad ma rig pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from darkness with regard to all phenomena because it is free from ignorance and so on with regard to all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad mi shes pa sel ba ni chos rnams thams cad ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi shes pa sel ba ni chos rnams thams cad ma rig pa 'gags pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It eliminates non-knowledge with regard to all phenomena because it destroys the conception that all phenomena are stopped by the cessation of ignorance and so on.

original: chos thams cad mi shes pa sel ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi shes pa sel ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
