original: de lta bas na zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i sgra'i bar gyis ni yongs su gtad pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i sgra'i bar gyis ni yongs su gtad pa dang po'o //
translated: The uncertain is the other than the certain, which is the attainment of the hundred.üîΩ The uncertain is the other than the

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes pa ni des bar du gcod pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / rjes su bstan pa ni yongs su gtad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes pa ni des bar du gcod pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / rjes su bstan pa ni yongs su gtad pa ste /
translated: By the empowerment of the Tathagata means that in order to avert obstacles, the teaching is entrusted.

original: ji ltar 'di nyan pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyan pa la sogs pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that you should listen to it without interruption.

original: 'di la gsungs pa ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la gsungs pa ni 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the statement is this, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ni yongs su gtad pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ni yongs su gtad pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Why is it so? etc. is the second entrustment.

original: @221a * // gleng bslang ba'o //
analyzed: @221a * // gleng bslang ba'o //
translated: The introduction.

original: 'di las ni kun du bstod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las ni kun du bstod pa'o //
translated: Here, it is praised.

original: sku 'di las ni gleng bslang ba gcig la yongs su gtad pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sku 'di las ni gleng bslang ba gcig la yongs su gtad pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: From this body, there is one introduction and two entrustments.

original: gang du gsungs pa'i lan gnyis lan gsum du yang zhes pa ni yongs su gtad do ni gtod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang du gsungs pa'i lan gnyis lan gsum du yang zhes pa ni yongs su gtad do ni gtod pa byed pa'o //
translated: In response to the question, where was it spoken? etc. is the second entrustment.üîΩEntrusted means entrusted.

original: rjes su gtad do ni rjes su mthun pas gtad pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su gtad do ni rjes su mthun pas gtad pa'o //
translated: Entrusted in accordance means entrusted in accordance.

original: skyes bu tha ma zhes pa ni ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu tha ma zhes pa ni ma gus pa'o //
translated: The worst person means disrespectful.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bdag gi dngos po bzhin du gus par bya zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩji srid du zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs zhes pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das ma 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag gi mu med pa'i yon tan rnams dang ngo bo nyid kyi yang rgyu yin pas na 'dir mchog tu gus par bya bar
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bdag gi dngos po bzhin du gus par bya zhes gsungs pa ni / ji srid du zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs zhes pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das ma 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag gi mu med pa'i yon tan rnams dang ngo bo nyid kyi yang rgyu yin pas na 'dir mchog tu gus par bya bar
translated: Why should I respect this like my own self?üîΩAs long as the Tathagata abides,üîΩThe Tathagata abides means that in whatever place this very Bhagavati is, there is the infinite qualities of the causal and resultant states of the Tathagata, and she is the very cause of their essence. Therefore, here she is to be respected supremely.

original: rigs zhes pa la dgongs pa de'i yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag gi yon tan gyi che ba mdo sde mtha' yas la mang po bstan pa de'i zhad tsam brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma la shin tu yang dag pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir
analyzed: rigs zhes pa la dgongs pa de'i yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs dag gi yon tan gyi che ba mdo sde mtha' yas la mang po bstan pa de'i zhad tsam brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das ma la shin tu yang dag pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir
translated: The intention of the word lineage is that the greatness of the qualities of the causal and resultant states of that is taught in the infinite sutras, and to express just a fraction of that is to generate the most perfect respect for the Bhagavati.

original: te / de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las tshogs kyi sa la dang po dang bdun pa'i sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kun du skyed par byed pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pas yang dag par bskyed cing mnyam pa'i sems kyis
analyzed: te / de ltar yang 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las tshogs kyi sa la dang po dang bdun pa'i sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kun du skyed par byed pa thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pas yang dag par bskyed cing mnyam pa'i sems kyis
translated: He generates the wisdom of all that is to be generated by means of non-conceptualization and,

original: sems can rnams thams cad kyang de'i ye shes la rab tu sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams thams cad kyang de'i ye shes la rab tu sbyor bar byed /
translated: with an attitude of equality, he applies all sentient beings to that wisdom.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' de la yang sngon du sangs rgyas mthong /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' de la yang sngon du sangs rgyas mthong /
translated: The powerful gods, having seen the Buddha before,

original: lha stobs dang ldan par 'gyur bas spro ba skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: lha stobs dang ldan par 'gyur bas spro ba skyed par byed kyi /
translated: excite him,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan byed pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the arhats who are absorbed in the eight liberations.üîΩThe lineage of the Buddha will continue through him.

original: de'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyud mi gcad par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang /
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyud mi gcad par gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang /
translated: And the Bodhisattvapitaka states:

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni sems bskyed pa dang bcas pas sems can thams cad kyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur zhing bla mar gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing pha dang 'dra baüîΩste / bsod nams rab tu bskyed pa rnams kyang gegs med pa yongs su 'dzin cing gang gis bsrungs shing de la ma zhen pas gnyid log pa dang bag med pa na yang sdig sbrul dang gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa de na gnas pa rnams kyis tho @221b
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa'i phan yon gsungs pa ni sems bskyed pa dang bcas pas sems can thams cad kyi sbyin gnas su 'gyur zhing bla mar gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing pha dang 'dra ba ste / bsod nams rab tu bskyed pa rnams kyang gegs med pa yongs su 'dzin cing gang gis bsrungs shing de la ma zhen pas gnyid log pa dang bag med pa na yang sdig sbrul dang gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa de na gnas pa rnams kyis tho @221b
translated: By generating the mind, one becomes the object of generosity for all sentient beings and becomes a field of merit like a father.

original: 'tshams par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'tshams par mi nus so //
translated: Even those who have generated much merit are protected without hindrance, and even when they are asleep or careless, the evil nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, and non-humans who live there are unable to harm them.

original: yongs su 'jug pa'i skye bo de la bsod nams kyis nang nyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'jug pa'i skye bo de la bsod nams kyis nang nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The merit of those who enter there increases.

original: skye bar gnod pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di'i dran pa brjed ngas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar gnod pa med par 'gyur ro // 'di'i dran pa brjed ngas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be harmed in their births.üîΩThey will not forgetfulness.

original: sems nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not have a degenerated mind.

original: gzhan gyi lag tu 'ongs kyang mi 'grub pa'i sems can rnams kyi yams dang nye bar 'tshe ba dang log 'dren ma rungs pa'i sngags kyi tshig dang rig pa'i tshig rnams de'i lag tu song bas 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lag tu 'ongs kyang mi 'grub pa'i sems can rnams kyi yams dang nye bar 'tshe ba dang log 'dren ma rungs pa'i sngags kyi tshig dang rig pa'i tshig rnams de'i lag tu song bas 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: Even if they fall into the hands of others, the spells and incantations of the evil ones who cause disease, harm, and demonic influences to sentient beings will be accomplished by falling into their hands.

original: grub pa rnams la lta ci smos la /
analyzed: grub pa rnams la lta ci smos la /
translated: What need is there to mention those who are accomplished?

original: gang du sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gnas pa der 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba dang mu ge'i skyon dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba rnams mi 'byung zhing byung na yang nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gnas pa der 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba dang mu ge'i skyon dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba rnams mi 'byung zhing byung na yang nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever they dwell in a buddhafield, the faults of fear, anxiety, and famine, and the harm caused by non-human beings, will not occur. Even if they do occur, they will be pacified.

original: gal te brgya lam na dmyal ba dang ngan 'gro'i sa rnams su skye ba na yang der yang de tsam gyis shin tu myur bar gyur pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te brgya lam na dmyal ba dang ngan 'gro'i sa rnams su skye ba na yang der yang de tsam gyis shin tu myur bar gyur pas grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are born in the hells and lower realms, even there they will be liberated very quickly.

original: dmyal ba rnams su sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chung bar gyur pa dang / shin tu myur bar yid 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur zhing sems can de rnams la snying rje chen po'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams su sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba chung bar gyur pa dang / shin tu myur bar yid 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur zhing sems can de rnams la snying rje chen po'i sems skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the hells, the feeling of suffering becomes small, and quickly, the mind becomes disgusted, and the thought of great compassion for those sentient beings arises.

original: yum chen mor yang mos pas spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed kyi dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'i sems can rnams rang gi lus kyi 'od kyis kun du snang bar byas nas sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byas nas kyang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed de /
analyzed: yum chen mor yang mos pas spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ji snyed kyi dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'i sems can rnams rang gi lus kyi 'od kyis kun du snang bar byas nas sdug bsngal thams cad zhi bar byas nas kyang sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i lha dang mi rnams su skye bar byed de /
translated: The Great Mother says that through devoted conduct, the bodhisattva‚Äôs compassion illuminates with the light of his body the sentient beings in the hells, animals, pretas, and so on, in each of the ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, and having pacified all their suffering, he causes them to be born as gods and humans together with the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la byed pa nyan du bcug nas de yid la byas pas de rnams ngan 'gro rnams las byung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa dang rjes su mthun par sbyor ba yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la byed pa nyan du bcug nas de yid la byas pas de rnams ngan 'gro rnams las byung nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa dang rjes su mthun par sbyor ba yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Having made them listen to mental attention to the Buddha, etc., by means of that mental attention, they are born from the miserable realms and take up the practice that is suitable for pleasing the perfect Buddha.üîΩThe six perfections, etc., increase without interruption and they surpass the stage of the Bodhisattva Joyful.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad par lhag par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rab tu dga' ba'i sa byang chub sems dpa' gnon par gyur nas byis pa'i skye bo thams cad dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das par
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyun mi 'chad par lhag par 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rab tu dga' ba'i sa byang chub sems dpa' gnon par gyur nas byis pa'i skye bo thams cad dang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das par
translated: They surpass all the stages of the foolish, the Sravakas, and the Pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'gyur zhing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par skye bar 'gyur nas /
analyzed: 'gyur zhing byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par skye bar 'gyur nas /
translated: They are born in the Bodhisattva's faultless stage.üîΩThey do not cut off the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mi gcod kyi mthong ba'i lam la'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs mi gcod kyi mthong ba'i lam la'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the path of seeing.

original: sa bcu pa las kyang /
analyzed: sa bcu pa las kyang /
translated: The Dasabhumika says:

original: skad cig ma gcig gis ting nge 'dzin @222a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis ting nge 'dzin @222a * //
translated: In one instant, they enter into the samadhi of the Bodhisattvas called 'Array of the Ornaments of the Universes'.

original: brgya thob cing snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par shes la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo ba dang kun du snang bar byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyar 'gro zhing sems can brgya smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: brgya thob cing snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par shes la 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo ba dang kun du snang bar byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyar 'gro zhing sems can brgya smin par byed pa dang /
translated: They attain and enter a hundred meditative absorptions, see a hundred buddhas, and understand the blessings of those buddhas. They shake a hundred world systems and illuminate them. They go to a hundred buddha-fields and bring a hundred sentient beings to full maturity.

original: bskal pa brgyar gnas shing sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la rab tu 'jug cing chos zhal brgyas rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / lus brgyar ston par byed do //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar gnas shing sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la rab tu 'jug cing chos zhal brgyas rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa dang / lus brgyar ston par byed do //
translated: They remain for a hundred eons, and they engage with the past and the future. They discern a hundred Dharma doors and manifest a hundred bodies.

original: lus re re la byang chub sems dpa' brgya'i 'khor kun tu ston par byed ces gsungs te /
analyzed: lus re re la byang chub sems dpa' brgya'i 'khor kun tu ston par byed ces gsungs te /
translated: In each body they manifest a retinue of a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams sdig pa las bzlog pa'i bdag por byas nas las kyi 'gro ba nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams sdig pa las bzlog pa'i bdag por byas nas las kyi 'gro ba nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: They engage with the past and the future means that they teach the destinies of sentient beings‚Äô actions, having become the masters of turning sentient beings away from evil.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang gi blo yongs su smin pa'i don du chos kyi rnam grangs rnams kyi don sems par byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rang gi blo yongs su smin pa'i don du chos kyi rnam grangs rnams kyi don sems par byed ces pa'o //
translated: Thorough differentiation is the contemplation of the meaning of the Dharma teachings for the sake of perfecting one's own understanding.

original: thams cad du brgya bzung ba ni nges par 'gyur ba nyid kyis so //üîΩthabs la mkhas pas ni grangs med de /
analyzed: thams cad du brgya bzung ba ni nges par 'gyur ba nyid kyis so // thabs la mkhas pas ni grangs med de /
translated: Retaining everything is due to the certainty of retention.üîΩBy skill in means, one sees countless buddhas.

original: grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba ni tshogs kyis nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ba ni tshogs kyis nas kyang ngo //
translated: By the accumulation of merit, one sees countless buddhas.

original: 'di rnams kyi yang grangs nges pa dang ma nges pa dag ni sngon gyi sa'i yon tan rnams bzhin 'dis phyi ma rnams la rjes su zhugs nas rab tu gyur pa yang thog ma'i dbye bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi yang grangs nges pa dang ma nges pa dag ni sngon gyi sa'i yon tan rnams bzhin 'dis phyi ma rnams la rjes su zhugs nas rab tu gyur pa yang thog ma'i dbye bas shes par bya'o //
translated: The definite and indefinite numbers of these are like the qualities of the previous stages. One should understand that the increase is due to the initial division, having entered into the subsequent ones.

original: de nyid kyi dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nyid yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is the basis of these immeasurable qualities becomes the lord of Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i bdag po thob pa dang chos rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir phung po yongs su gtong yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i bdag po thob pa dang chos rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir phung po yongs su gtong yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he gives away his aggregates in order to attain the lordship of Mahe≈õvara and to protect the Dharma, they are not exhausted.

original: des 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i ma chags pa dang dga' bas 'dod pa la longs spyod pa yang rnam pa mang po ston par byed cing de la yang chags pa med do //
analyzed: des 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po'i ma chags pa dang dga' bas 'dod pa la longs spyod pa yang rnam pa mang po ston par byed cing de la yang chags pa med do //
translated: He displays many kinds of enjoyment of sense objects with the passion and nonattachment of a universal monarch, and he is not attached to them.

original: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba kun du 'dzin cing de la chags par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba kun du 'dzin cing de la chags par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: He does not hold on to the means of livelihood of all mundane perfections and become attached to them.

original: sgyu ma lta bur chos thams cad bsgoms pas yang sems can gdul bar bya ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa la dbang du gyur pa thob nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur chos thams cad bsgoms pas yang sems can gdul bar bya ba nye bar bzung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa la dbang du gyur pa thob nas /
translated: Because he meditates on all phenomena as being like illusions, he attains mastery over the afflictions in order to take on the discipline of sentient beings.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bus 'dod pa las rgyal ba'i sras rnams yongs su longs spyod kyi sdug pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bus 'dod pa las rgyal ba'i sras rnams yongs su longs spyod kyi sdug pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The victors‚Äô heirs enjoy sense objects with a special intention, like an illusory person, not with attachment.

original: yang na mi 'dod pas ni 'dir khyim @222b dang chung ma la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na mi 'dod pas ni 'dir khyim @222b dang chung ma la sogs pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po yang spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Or else, since he does not desire them, he renounces the retinue of a universal monarch, such as wife and home, and goes forth into the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: ji ltar yang 'di nyid rab tu byung nas de ltar gong ma'i yang rang gis rnams la ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'di nyid rab tu byung nas de ltar gong ma'i yang rang gis rnams la ste /
translated: And just as he goes forth, so he goes further to the higher stages.

original: de bzhin du sa 'di'i yon tan rnams dang / sa snga ma'i yon tan gyis sprin la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa 'dir gsal bar byas nas ring du yang 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa 'di'i yon tan rnams dang / sa snga ma'i yon tan gyis sprin la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa 'dir gsal bar byas nas ring du yang 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the qualities of this stage, such as the superknowledges of clairvoyance, etc., are clarified by the qualities of the earlier stages, like clouds, and he goes further.

original: de'i yang gong nas gong gi sa'i yon tan ni mu med pa rnams te /
analyzed: de'i yang gong nas gong gi sa'i yon tan ni mu med pa rnams te /
translated: And the qualities of the higher stages are infinite.

original: de ltar na yang de'i yon tan gyi zhad tsam brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i yon tan gyi zhad tsam brjod par bya ste /
translated: Still, one should mention just a fraction of his qualities.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: As the noble Dasabhumika Sutra says,

original: dri ma med pa'i sa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de nyid rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i gling bzhi la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sa pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang de nyid rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i gling bzhi la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur te /
translated: Bodhisattvas on the stainless levels become universal emperors ruling over the four continents and possessing the seven precious articles.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ni 'di'i sngar bshad pa'i brgya'i gnas su stong phrag bshad pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa ni 'di'i sngar bshad pa'i brgya'i gnas su stong phrag bshad pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: The qualities of meditative concentration and so forth are the qualities explained as a hundred times greater than the previous level, that is, as a thousand.

original: 'od byed pa la legs par so sor brtags pa'i ye shes kyis yang nas yang du dam pa'i chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson pas gnas shing nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer zhing chos smra ba po la dga' bar byed pa'i 'du shes can
analyzed: 'od byed pa la legs par so sor brtags pa'i ye shes kyis yang nas yang du dam pa'i chos tshol ba la mngon par brtson pas gnas shing nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer zhing chos smra ba po la dga' bar byed pa'i 'du shes can
translated: On the illuminating level, bodhisattvas are intent on seeking the sacred Dharma again and again with the gnosis of thorough analysis and they abide in that, striving to listen to the teachings day and night, with a sense of joy in the Dharma teacher.

original: du 'gyur zhing des phyi dang nang gi dngos po dang sbyin par mi byed pa cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: du 'gyur zhing des phyi dang nang gi dngos po dang sbyin par mi byed pa cung zad kyang med la /
translated: There is nothing internal or external that they will not give away.

original: bla ma'i spyod pas nye bar gnas pa gang sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: bla ma'i spyod pas nye bar gnas pa gang sbyin par byed cing /
translated: They give whatever they can and abide by the conduct of the teacher.

original: des gang yang lus la gnod pa na yang sbyin par mi byed pa med la /
analyzed: des gang yang lus la gnod pa na yang sbyin par mi byed pa med la /
translated: He does not withhold anything from anyone, even his own flesh.

original: rtag tu sbyin pa'i rgyus chos la gus pa rab tu son pas des nor dang rgyal srid dang / mtho ris su skye ba dang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / bdag gi dngos pos kyang chos la bla mar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyin pa'i rgyus chos la gus pa rab tu son pas des nor dang rgyal srid dang / mtho ris su skye ba dang 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / bdag gi dngos pos kyang chos la bla mar byed do //
translated: He is always devoted to the Dharma, having attained the highest stage of generosity. Therefore, he honors the Dharma with wealth, kingdom, rebirth in heaven, mundane purification, and even his own life.

original: de yang chos kyis dga' bar byed par 'gyur gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / tshangs pa dang brgya byin gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos kyis dga' bar byed par 'gyur gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang / tshangs pa dang brgya byin gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: He delights in the Dharma, not in being a universal monarch or in being Brahma or Indra.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'jog pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig la yang de'i don du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du re zhig mes yongs su gang ba la bdag nyid mchong ba la yang sproüîΩbar byed la /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'jog pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig la yang de'i don du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du re zhig mes yongs su gang ba la bdag nyid mchong ba la yang sproüîΩbar byed la /
translated: He is even willing to throw himself into a great trichiliocosm filled with fire up to the Brahma world for the sake of a single word of Dharma that leads to perfect awakening.

original: de nyid yang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i dbang por gyur nas dge bas sems can 'dod pa'i 'dam las 'byin bar 'dod pa ste 'di'i yon tan no //üîΩting nge 'dzin la sogs @223a * //
analyzed: de nyid yang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i dbang por gyur nas dge bas sems can 'dod pa'i 'dam las 'byin bar 'dod pa ste 'di'i yon tan no // ting nge 'dzin la sogs @223a * //
translated: He himself, having become the lord of the Thirty-Three, through virtue wishes to rescue beings from the mire of desire. These are the virtues of this stage.

original: pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su stong phrag bshad pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su stong phrag bshad pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: The virtues of the samadhis, etc., are the virtues explained in the hundred thousand.

original: 'od 'phro ba la yang de nyid rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal por gyur nas khyab bdag byas nas sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par bcom pa la mkhas pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba la yang de nyid rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal por gyur nas khyab bdag byas nas sems can rnams kyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang dag par bcom pa la mkhas pas sems can rnams yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir ro
translated: In the Radiant, he himself, having become the king of the Yamas, having become the universal lord, through skill in the destruction of the belief in the transitory aggregates of beings, establishes beings in the right view.

original: // ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa 'di'i yon tan ni brgyar bshad do //
analyzed: // ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa 'di'i yon tan ni brgyar bshad do //
translated: The virtues of this samadhi, etc., are explained in the hundred thousand.

original: sbyang dka' ba la ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba phrag stong gis bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams te yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal por gyur nas mnga' bdag byas nas sems can thams cad mu stegs kyi skye mched thams cad bzlog pa
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba la ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba phrag stong gis bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams te yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal por gyur nas mnga' bdag byas nas sems can thams cad mu stegs kyi skye mched thams cad bzlog pa
translated: Having become a king of the Tushita gods, he rules over them and, through his skill in refuting all the views of the tirthikas,

original: la mkhas pas sems can rnams bden pa rnams la rab tu dgod par 'dod pas so //üîΩmngon par gyur pa la ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis bshad pa'i yon tan rnams te yang de nyid las 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal po byas nas sems can rnams kyi mngon par nga rgyal ba so sor sbyang ba la mkhas pas sems can
analyzed: la mkhas pas sems can rnams bden pa rnams la rab tu dgod par 'dod pas so // mngon par gyur pa la ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis bshad pa'i yon tan rnams te yang de nyid las 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal po byas nas sems can rnams kyi mngon par nga rgyal ba so sor sbyang ba la mkhas pas sems can
translated: he wishes to establish all sentient beings in the four noble truths.üîΩOn the level of the Immovable, the qualities of concentration and so on are a hundred thousand times greater than a hundred thousand times those of the level of the joyous.

original: rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gzhug par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gzhug par 'dod pas so //
translated: Having become a king of the gods of the Nirmanarati realm, he wishes to introduce sentient beings to dependent origination, through his skill in purifying their individual conceit.

original: ring du song ba la sems can la phan pa'i don du bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas mngon par shes pa drug gis kyang ste /
analyzed: ring du song ba la sems can la phan pa'i don du bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas mngon par shes pa drug gis kyang ste /
translated: On the ground Gone Far Beyond, having entered into the concentrations and absorptions of meditative stability and liberation for the sake of benefiting sentient beings, they also make use of the six kinds of preternatural knowledge.

original: de ltar yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi don skad cig ma gcig la 'gro ba drug gi sems can gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs sprul pa rnams kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams kyi sems can rnams kyi don skad cig ma gcig la 'gro ba drug gi sems can gyi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs sprul pa rnams kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
translated: Thus, in a single instant, they accomplish the welfare of sentient beings in the countless world systems of the ten directions by means of emanations in the various forms of the six kinds of beings in the universe.

original: lha la sogs pa dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyis ji srid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams su sprul pas go bar byed la /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa dang nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyis ji srid du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams su sprul pas go bar byed la /
translated: With their emanations, they make themselves understood in the countless world systems of the ten directions, to the retinues of gods and so forth, of listeners and of bodhisattvas.

original: de'i yang dbyangs rnams kyis rnam pa du ma'i chos ston par mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: de'i yang dbyangs rnams kyis rnam pa du ma'i chos ston par mdzad pa'am /
translated: With their voices, they teach the Dharma in many different ways.

original: gzhan dag sprul pa mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag sprul pa mdzad pa'am /
translated: Or they emanate other beings.

original: nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung la yul rnams dang ston mo dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems can gyi don du sprul pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ba dag kyang ston par mdzad de de'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi phrag gis ston @223b pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las kyang chos ston pa'i sgra 'byung la yul rnams dang ston mo dang bza' ba dang btung ba dang gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa sems can gyi don du sprul pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye ba dag kyang ston par mdzad de de'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi phrag gis ston @223b pa'o //
translated: And from the sky, the sound of the Dharma teaching arises. He emanates various things for the benefit of sentient beings, such as objects, feasts, food, drink, clothing, jewels, and so on. He also displays birth in the animal realm. His qualities such as samadhi are taught to be a hundred times greater than those of the previous level.

original: yang des gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i dbang po mnga' bdag tu mdzad nas sems can rnams mngon par rtogs pa shes pa rnams kyis nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang des gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i dbang po mnga' bdag tu mdzad nas sems can rnams mngon par rtogs pa shes pa rnams kyis nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Moreover, having become the lord of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods, he attracts sentient beings with his superknowledges.

original: mi g-yo ba la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba la 'jug cing thams cad du sems yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos skye ba med pa can gyi bzod pa thob pa'oüîΩzhes brjod la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba la 'jug cing thams cad du sems yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos skye ba med pa can gyi bzod pa thob pa'o zhes brjod la /
translated: On the Immovable, the bodhisattva enters into the suchness of all dharmas and everywhere attains the acceptance of the nonarising of all dharmas free from the discriminations of the conceptual thoughts of mind and mental factors.

original: de thob nas ji ltar gzhan gyi ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror rnam par smin pa'i las kyi sgrib pa de rnams yang dag par bcad nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de thob nas ji ltar gzhan gyi ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror rnam par smin pa'i las kyi sgrib pa de rnams yang dag par bcad nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal te /
translated: Having attained that, just as the obscurations of karma that ripen in the bad and good destinies of others are completely eliminated, the bhagavat buddhas say this:

original: legs so legs so rigs kyi bu 'di nyid ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs par bya ba la 'di nyid don dam pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: legs so legs so rigs kyi bu 'di nyid ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rtogs par bya ba la 'di nyid don dam pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent, son of good lineage! This is the ultimate acceptance that realizes the dharmas of the buddhas in that way.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang bdag cag gi stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yang dag par sangs rgyas pa de re zhig khyod la yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas de btsal ba la mngon par dga' bar gyis la brtson 'grus rtsoms
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag cag gi stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yang dag par sangs rgyas pa de re zhig khyod la yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas de btsal ba la mngon par dga' bar gyis la brtson 'grus rtsoms
translated: However, since the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities of the buddhas are not present in you, you should delight in seeking them and apply yourself with diligence.

original: shig dang 'di nyid kyis bzod pa'i sgo nas ma btang zhig dang / gang khyod de ltar zhi ba la gnas pas rjes su thob cing zhi ba 'dis byis pa so so'i skye bo la dgongs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shig dang 'di nyid kyis bzod pa'i sgo nas ma btang zhig dang / gang khyod de ltar zhi ba la gnas pas rjes su thob cing zhi ba 'dis byis pa so so'i skye bo la dgongs pa ma yin te /
translated: Do not give up on this very patience, and through this very patience, you will attain peace. This peace is not intended for childish ordinary beings.

original: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu sngon gyi smon lam rjes su dran pa dang sems can gyi don yang dag par thob pa'i ye shes kyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang 'dir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid chos thams cad dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu sngon gyi smon lam rjes su dran pa dang sems can gyi don yang dag par thob pa'i ye shes kyi sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang 'dir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid chos thams cad dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: However, son of noble family, you should remember your previous aspirations and the inconceivable wisdom gateway that truly attains the benefit of sentient beings. Here, the emptiness of all phenomena is the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: gang 'di dag gi yang yud tsam cig gis ye shes lhun gyis grub pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gnon par byed do //
analyzed: gang 'di dag gi yang yud tsam cig gis ye shes lhun gyis grub pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gnon par byed do //
translated: And in a mere instant, through spontaneous wisdom, they outshine all with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ni sngon gyi 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyi bskal ba brgya stong gis kyang re zhig gzhal du med par thob par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi 'bad pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyi bskal ba brgya stong gis kyang re zhig gzhal du med par thob par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: This cannot be attained even in a hundred thousand eons of the path with its previous efforts.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can rnams kyang so so'i rab tu dbye ba na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi sems can rnams kyang so so'i rab tu dbye ba na /
translated: The beings of the world systems are also individually distinguished.

original: ji srid du rdul phra rab kyi cha de srid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: ji srid du rdul phra rab kyi cha de srid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: As far as the subtle particles go, they are known as they are.

original: ji 'dra ba'i yang sems can rnams kyi lus su rnam par phye ba'i kha dog dang rtags dang chu dang zheng dang mos pa dang bsam pa dang de rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su yang de dang der de ltar rang gi lus kun du ston par byed de /
analyzed: ji 'dra ba'i yang sems can rnams kyi lus su rnam par phye ba'i kha dog dang rtags dang chu dang zheng dang mos pa dang bsam pa dang de rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su yang de dang der de ltar rang gi lus kun du ston par byed de /
translated: In whatever way they are distinguished in the bodies of sentient beings, in whatever colors, signs, shapes, sizes, interests, and attitudes, and in those buddhafields and buddha assemblies, they display their bodies in that way.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang @224a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze dang rgyal rigs dang @224a * //
translated: They display the forms of ascetics, brahmins, royalty,üîΩhouseholders, and those who enjoy the six sense objects, and they display the form of BrahmƒÅ. They display the forms of the assemblies up to Akani·π£·π≠ha, and in the assemblies up to Akani·π£·π≠ha, they display the form of Akani·π£·π≠ha. They display the forms of ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas,

original: khyim bdag dang 'dod pa drug na spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gzugs su kun tu ston par byed la rang rang gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams ji srid du 'og min gyi bar gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams la 'og min gyi gzugs kun du ston cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: khyim bdag dang 'dod pa drug na spyod pa dang / tshangs pa'i gzugs su kun tu ston par byed la rang rang gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams ji srid du 'og min gyi bar gyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams la 'og min gyi gzugs kun du ston cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'
translated: bodhisattvas, and buddhas.

original: dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa ni gzugs de dang des gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kun du ston pa ni gzugs de dang des gdul bar bya ba'i sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: And the display of the form of the Tathagata is for the sake of the welfare of those beings who are to be trained by that form.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa 'dis gang zhig gi smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang grangs med pa'i smon lam mngon par grub pa ni de las gzhan pa'i de'i yongs su dag pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i bla lhag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa 'dis gang zhig gi smon lam chen po bcu la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang grangs med pa'i smon lam mngon par grub pa ni de las gzhan pa'i de'i yongs su dag pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i bla lhag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the perfection of vows, which is superior to the other perfections.

original: sa 'di la ni shin tu phra ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyu ba yang yod pa ma yin pas de ltar 'dod pa lnga yongs su longs spyod pa mi srid pa nyid de /
analyzed: sa 'di la ni shin tu phra ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyu ba yang yod pa ma yin pas de ltar 'dod pa lnga yongs su longs spyod pa mi srid pa nyid de /
translated: Since even the subtlest operation of the afflictions does not exist on this ground, the enjoyment of the five kinds of sense objects is impossible.

original: de lta na yang sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang sems can yongs su smin pa'i rgyur 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la byang chub sems dpa' rjes su gnas pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the bodhisattva remains in the five sense objects for the sake of beings to be trained.

original: de ltar yang bdag cag gi ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pas sems can sdud pa'i phyir grags 'dzin dang skye dgu'i bdag mo la sogs pa'i bud med nyi khri bzhi stong rnams la re re zhing bdag gi lus mngon par sprul nas de rnams thams
analyzed: de ltar yang bdag cag gi ston pa byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pas sems can sdud pa'i phyir grags 'dzin dang skye dgu'i bdag mo la sogs pa'i bud med nyi khri bzhi stong rnams la re re zhing bdag gi lus mngon par sprul nas de rnams thams
translated: Thus our teacher, the bodhisattva, attracted beings by means of the gift of Dharma and by means of the gift of material things.

original: cad la rol par mdzad de /
analyzed: cad la rol par mdzad de /
translated: In order to attract beings, he manifested as a woman and enjoyed all of them.

original: sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug 'phags pa chos 'phags kyang bud med drug khri brgyad stong rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po rnams la rol pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i dbang phyug 'phags pa chos 'phags kyang bud med drug khri brgyad stong rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po rnams la rol pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The lord of the tenth level, sublime Dharmodgata, enjoyed the five sense objects together with 68,000 women.

original: sa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yang tshangs pa chen po nyid du gyur nas stong dang po la dbang sgyur ba'i mnga' bdag thob nas sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa 'di la byang chub sems dpa' yang tshangs pa chen po nyid du gyur nas stong dang po la dbang sgyur ba'i mnga' bdag thob nas sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: On this level, the bodhisattva becomes a great Brahma and attains mastery over the first concentration and attracts beings by means of the transcendent perfections.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams stong phrag brgya'i rdul phra rab kyi grangs kyis gsungs pas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i yon tan ni brgya'i gnas su stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams stong phrag brgya'i rdul phra rab kyi grangs kyis gsungs pas so //
translated: The qualities of concentration, etc. are said to be a hundred times greater than the previous ones, by the number of atoms in a hundred systems of a thousand worlds.

original: legs pa'i blo gros la byang chub sems dpa' 'dod na yi ge gcig gi skad kyis chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i skad 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la byang chub sems dpa' 'dod na yi ge gcig gi skad kyis chos thams cad kyi tshig rab tu dbye ba'i skad 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the ground of Good Intelligence, the bodhisattva, if he wishes, can emit the sounds of all the words that distinguish all phenomena with a single sound.

original: ba spu'i bu ga rnams nas 'od kyi 'od zer nam mkha' nas byung bas 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga rnams nas 'od kyi 'od zer nam mkha' nas byung bas 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams gsal bar byed do //
translated: From his pores, light rays arise in the sky and illuminate the forms, etc. in a hundred world systems.

original: 'dir 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i @224b bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i @224b bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Here, this is the perfect teaching in brief.

original: 'di yang stong gnyis pa'i bdag po khyab bdag tshangs pa chen por gyur nas sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag rnams la ste /
analyzed: 'di yang stong gnyis pa'i bdag po khyab bdag tshangs pa chen por gyur nas sems can rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i gdams ngag rnams la ste /
translated: And this is the perfect teaching in detail: having become the lord of a second order thousand world system, the great Brahma, he gives instructions to sentient beings in the perfections, etc.

original: brgya'i gnas su stong gsum grangs med pa'i brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs kyis ston pa 'di'i yon tan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bla lhag par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brgya'i gnas su stong gsum grangs med pa'i brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi grangs kyis ston pa 'di'i yon tan rnams ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bla lhag par gyur pa ste /
translated: The qualities of this teacher are shown to be a hundred times greater than the previous ones, by the number of atoms in a hundred thousand times ten million billion worlds.

original: de la bsam pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa mngon du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of intention, there is no manifestation of the afflictions.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs kyis ni sa'i ye shes yongs su sbyangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs kyis ni sa'i ye shes yongs su sbyangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of superior intention, there is the purification of the wisdom of the stages.

original: gzugs kyi stobs kyis ni chos brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stobs kyis ni chos brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of form, there is the inexpressibility of the Dharma.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni rtag pa g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ni rtag pa g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of samadhi, there is constant immobility.

original: yang dag par 'phel ba'i stobs kyis ni mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa rnam par phye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'phel ba'i stobs kyis ni mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi spyod pa rnam par phye ba la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of right increase, there is skill in the analysis of conduct in limitless world systems.

original: dbang gi stobs kyis ni mngon par 'dod pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang gi stobs kyis ni mngon par 'dod pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of the superknowledges, he attains the fulfillment of all his wishes.

original: spobs pa'i stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spobs pa'i stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of eloquence, he is skilled in discerning all the Buddha teachings.

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi spyod pa rnams kyi sbyor ba mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi spyod pa rnams kyi sbyor ba mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of vows, he does not abandon the practice of all the Buddha teachings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa spyod pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis ni bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i sems can thams cad la phan pa spyod pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of the transcendences, he does not abandon the benefit of self and other, maturing himself with the Buddha qualities and maturing others.

original: byams pa chen po'i stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su sbyor ba rjes su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su sbyor ba rjes su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of great compassion, he does not abandon the protection of all beings.

original: snying rje chen po'i stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i stobs kyis ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of great compassion, because of eliminating the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: chos nyid kyi stobs kyis ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi stobs kyis ni sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of reality, because of manifesting the reality of illusion-like, etc.üîΩBy the power of the blessing of all the Tathagatas, because of the manifestation of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i stobs ni mdo sder bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i stobs kyis ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'i stobs ni mdo sder bshad pa'o //
translated: The powers are explained in the sutra.

original: chos kyi sprin la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur la de'i rjes la 'di ltar stong phrag @225a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur la de'i rjes la 'di ltar stong phrag @225a * //
translated: In the Cloud of Truth stage, the bodhisattva is endowed with the consecration of the knowledge of all modes, and the samadhi called ‚Äúendowed with the consecration of the knowledge of all modes‚Äù is manifested.

original: de de'i ting nge 'dzin so sor thob nas padma de la bzhugs pa kun tu mthong bar gyur nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' de la yongs su bskor nas lta bar byed cing de rnams
analyzed: de de'i ting nge 'dzin so sor thob nas padma de la bzhugs pa kun tu mthong bar gyur nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'dus pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' de la yongs su bskor nas lta bar byed cing de rnams
translated: The bodhisattvas will be seated upon those lotuses, which are as large as ten billion worlds, and are adorned with the most sublime features and jeweled ornaments.

original: khor yug gi padma rnams la 'dug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khor yug gi padma rnams la 'dug par 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattvas will be

analyzed: de'i tshe yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kun tu g-yo bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: At that time, all world systems will be shaken.

original: ngan 'gro thams cad rab tu sbyangs nas thams cad skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lha dang mir gyur pa la yang dag par brjod pa kun tu gsungs pas sems bde ba
analyzed: ngan 'gro thams cad rab tu sbyangs nas thams cad skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa la byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lha dang mir gyur pa la yang dag par brjod pa kun tu gsungs pas sems bde ba
translated: Having purified all lower realms, all those with good fortune will engage in conduct. The bodhisattvas who have gathered will speak the true words to all gods and humans in all world systems, causing them to generate a blissful mind.

original: skyed pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur la rab tu zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la shes par byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyed pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur la rab tu zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la shes par byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will engage in inconceivable offerings and service to all perfectly awakened buddhas and will be known in the ma·πá·∏çalas of the retinue of all tathƒÅgatas.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i yang lus thams cad kyi yan lag las 'od zer rnam par spros nas /
translated: From all the limbs of the body of that bodhisattva, light rays will radiate.

analyzed: bgrang ba las shin tu 'das pa'i phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams snang bar byas nas steng gi bar snang la 'od zer chen po'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur ba la rab tu 'jug par byed do //
translated: Having illuminated the ma·πá·∏çalas of the retinue of tathƒÅgatas throughout the reaches of space in the ten directions, which are beyond enumeration, they form a ma·πá·∏çala of a great mass of light rays in the sky above and engage in making offerings and honoring all tathƒÅgatas.

original: ji srid du phyogs bcu ma lus pa'i chos kyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i me tog la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang na bza' dang rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa'i brtags pa rnams kyis 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i sna tshogs pa'i bkod pa'i rin po che la sogs pa'i char gyis /
analyzed: ji srid du phyogs bcu ma lus pa'i chos kyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i me tog la sogs pa dang / gdugs dang na bza' dang rin po che'i rgyan la sogs pa'i brtags pa rnams kyis 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i sna tshogs pa'i bkod pa'i rin po che la sogs pa'i char gyis /
translated: As long as all the worlds in the ten directions are filled with flowers and so forth, parasols, clothing, precious ornaments, and so forth, which are included in the realm of phenomena, they cause a rain of various arrays of precious things and so forth, which are beyond the domain of all worlds, to fall.

original: re re bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor @225b gyi dkyil 'khor la sprin bzhin du rab tu 'bab par byed do //
analyzed: re re bzhin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor @225b gyi dkyil 'khor la sprin bzhin du rab tu 'bab par byed do //
translated: Each of them rains down upon the retinue of the ma·πá·∏çala of the tathƒÅgatas like a cloud.

original: de'i rjes la de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs kyi 'og tu nub par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs kyi 'og tu nub par gyur nas /
translated: After that, they disappear under the feet of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: der yang phyogs bcu'i mthas gtugs pa'i rab 'byam gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kye grangs med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed pas sa dgu pa la rab tu gnas pa rnams 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' de la yang dag par mchod par byas nas lta bar
analyzed: der yang phyogs bcu'i mthas gtugs pa'i rab 'byam gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kye grangs med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed pas sa dgu pa la rab tu gnas pa rnams 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' de la yang dag par mchod par byas nas lta bar
translated: There, as many bodhisattvas as there are in the world systems of the ten directions, which are infinite in number, come and having arrived, they make offerings to the bodhisattva who is on the ninth bh≈´mi and they look at him.

original: byed cing ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byed cing ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: They enter into ten thousand samƒÅdhis.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer la grangs med pa'i 'od zer gyis yongs su bskor ba rnams kyis phyogs bcu mu med pa'i 'jig rten
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer la grangs med pa'i 'od zer gyis yongs su bskor ba rnams kyis phyogs bcu mu med pa'i 'jig rten
translated: From the ≈´r·πáƒÅ hair between the eyebrows of those tathƒÅgatas, light rays called endowed with the higher knowledge of omniscience, surrounded by countless light rays, illuminate the infinite world systems in the ten directions.

analyzed: gyi khams rab 'byam rnams kun du snang bar byed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston cing grangs med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams yang dag par bskul zhing 'ongs nas /
translated: Displaying the tathƒÅgatas‚Äô emanations, they encourage countless bodhisattvas to come.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus kyi mchog de la snun par 'gyur la de'i 'khor gyi 'od zer ni 'khor gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbu la nub par gyur to //
translated: Those light rays touch the crown of the head of that bodhisattva, and the surrounding light rays disappear into the crowns of the bodhisattvas in the retinue.

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' ye shes chen pos mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes brjod do /
translated: That is called the great wisdom empowerment of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob par gyur to //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob par gyur to //
translated: He has attained the door of liberation called ‚Äúthe inconceivable domain of the perfect Buddha.‚Äù

analyzed: rang gi smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pas de'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i skus skad cig ma gcig la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa rnams kyi rdul phra rab ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su spros pa'i dge ba'i bdud rtse'i
translated: By the power of his own aspirations, in a single instant, with various kinds of bodies, he emanates into as many world systems as there are atoms in countless world systems in the ten directions. With a rain of the nectar of virtue,

original: rgyun rnams kyi char gyis bsam pa ji ltar bar sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi mi shes pa las kun du byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul kun 'bar ba rnams thams cad zhi bar byed pas sa 'di la chos kyi sprin zhes brjod
analyzed: rgyun rnams kyi char gyis bsam pa ji ltar bar sems can rnams kyi thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi mi shes pa las kun du byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rdul kun 'bar ba rnams thams cad zhi bar byed pas sa 'di la chos kyi sprin zhes brjod
translated: he pacifies the burning dust of the afflictions that arise from ignorance in the minds of sentient beings, which has been present since beginningless time. Therefore, this ground is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: la ; de srid kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams dang dga' ldan du gnas pa nye bar bzung nas ji srid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad pa la lhag par gnas te /

translated: Until that time, he abides in the deeds of all tathagatas, from the time of taking birth in the Tu·π£ita heaven until the great parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

analyzed: grangs med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab kyi ji snyed pa de snyed kyi @226a * //
translated: He displays as many bodies as there are atoms in countless world systems.

original: lus du ma skad cig ma gcig la sprul pa'i lus re re la de snyed kyi phyag rnams dang / de snyed kyi dbu dang dbu re re zhing de snyed kyi ljags ston par byed la /
analyzed: lus du ma skad cig ma gcig la sprul pa'i lus re re la de snyed kyi phyag rnams dang / de snyed kyi dbu dang dbu re re zhing de snyed kyi ljags ston par byed la /
translated: In each moment, he emanates that many bodies, and in each body he displays that many hands, and in each hand he displays that many heads, and in each head he displays that many tongues.

original: phyag re res gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi me tog rnams thogs shing de rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gtor bar byed cing /
analyzed: phyag re res gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi me tog rnams thogs shing de rnams kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la gtor bar byed cing /
translated: With each hand he holds as many flowers as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river and scatters them on the bhagavat buddhas.

original: de bzhin du bdug pa la sogs pa rnams dang / ji snyed kyi na bza' dang gdugs dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdug pa la sogs pa rnams dang / ji snyed kyi na bza' dang gdugs dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pas so //
translated: Likewise, with as many arrays of incense and so on, and as many arrays of clothing, parasols, jewels and so on.

original: ljags de rnams kyis sangs rgyas de rnams kyi bstod pa gsungs shing sems kyi skad cig re re la phyogs bcur spros nas song bas mngon par byang chub pa'i bkod pa nas ji srid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi bkod pa byin
analyzed: ljags de rnams kyis sangs rgyas de rnams kyi bstod pa gsungs shing sems kyi skad cig re re la phyogs bcur spros nas song bas mngon par byang chub pa'i bkod pa nas ji srid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar gyi bkod pa byin
translated: With those tongues, he praises those Buddhas, and by emanating them in every single instant of mind in the ten directions, he blesses the arrays from manifest enlightenment up to the great parinirvana.

original: gyis brlabs nas ji snyed kyi zhal gyis phyogs re re mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams g-yo bar byed pa dang / ri rab chen po la sogs pa'i ri du ma skra nyag mas bcings nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par 'phen par byed kyang sems can de rnams la skrag par byed pa med do //
analyzed: gyis brlabs nas ji snyed kyi zhal gyis phyogs re re mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams g-yo bar byed pa dang / ri rab chen po la sogs pa'i ri du ma skra nyag mas bcings nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med par 'phen par byed kyang sems can de rnams la skrag par byed pa med do //
translated: With as many faces, he shakes every single direction, and with a single hair he binds many mountains such as Mount Meru and throws them into immeasurable world systems without frightening those sentient beings.

original: de ltar de la sogs pa'i grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'phel zhing mngon par shes pas rnam par rol par mngon par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar de la sogs pa'i grangs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'phel zhing mngon par shes pas rnam par rol par mngon par ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, he displays the increase of countless samƒÅdhis like that and the play of the superknowledges.

original: de skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i rgyal po mnga' bdag tu yang de nyid du gyur nas sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag rnams la bkod par 'dod pa de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: de skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i rgyal po mnga' bdag tu yang de nyid du gyur nas sems can rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag rnams la bkod par 'dod pa de ltar brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: He becomes the lord of the gods in the realm of the Pure Abodes, obstructed by only one birth, and he strives in that way, wishing to establish beings in the instructions of the perfections.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma gcig la phyogs bcur bgrang ba las 'das pa'i rdul phra rab ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ting nge 'dzin so sor thob cing de snyed kyi sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma gcig la phyogs bcur bgrang ba las 'das pa'i rdul phra rab ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ting nge 'dzin so sor thob cing de snyed kyi sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because in a single instant he attains as many samƒÅdhis and sees as many buddhas as there are atoms in the worlds beyond count in the ten directions.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs shes par 'gyur ba dang / de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams g-yo bar 'gyur zhing kun tu snang bar byed pa dang de snyed kyi zhing du 'gro zhing de snyed kyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs shes par 'gyur ba dang / de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams g-yo bar 'gyur zhing kun tu snang bar byed pa dang de snyed kyi zhing du 'gro zhing de snyed kyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
translated: they will know the blessings of those buddhas, they will shake and illuminate that many world systems, they will go to that many buddhafields, they will ripen that many sentient beings,

original: de snyed kyi bskal par gnas shing sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yang 'jug par 'gyur zhing de snyed kyi chos kyi sgo rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'gyur zhing de snyed kyi sku rnams ston par mdzad cing sku re re la yang de snyed kyi byang
analyzed: de snyed kyi bskal par gnas shing sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yang 'jug par 'gyur zhing de snyed kyi chos kyi sgo rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'gyur zhing de snyed kyi sku rnams ston par mdzad cing sku re re la yang de snyed kyi byang
translated: they will remain for that many eons, they will enter into the past and future, they will open that many Dharma doors, they will display that many bodies, and on each body they will display that many bodhisattvas.

original: chub sems dpa' 'khor du ma rnams dang / rang gi sku'i ba spu'i bu ga nas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i @226b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te re re zhing gzhal du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams dang skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du yang ston par byed la /üîΩgdul bar bya ba nyid brtags pa la kun tu spyod pas de las gzhan pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba rnams la tha dad pa'i brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa nyan
analyzed: chub sems dpa' 'khor du ma rnams dang / rang gi sku'i ba spu'i bu ga nas bgrang ba las 'das pa'i @226b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te re re zhing gzhal du med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams dang skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du yang ston par byed la / gdul bar bya ba nyid brtags pa la kun tu spyod pas de las gzhan pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba rnams la tha dad pa'i brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa nyan
translated: He displays himself in the retinue of bodhisattvas and in the pores of his body, as well as in the retinue of countless bhagavat buddhas, each with an immeasurable retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu 'di'i yon tan mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di'i yon tan mdor bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a brief presentation of the qualities of the tenth level.

original: ji skad du kye rgyal ba'i sras rnams de lta bu nyid kyis de bzhin du re zhig chos kyi sprin gyis bskal pa grangs med par bstan par byas kyang phyogs gcig tsam bstan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji skad du kye rgyal ba'i sras rnams de lta bu nyid kyis de bzhin du re zhig chos kyi sprin gyis bskal pa grangs med par bstan par byas kyang phyogs gcig tsam bstan par 'gyur na /
translated: As it is said, O children of the buddhas, in the same way, although the level of the cloud of Dharma has been described as lasting for countless kalpas, it is only a fraction that has been taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of the level of the tathagatas?

original: de yang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag gal te phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i phyogs kyi mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su de ltar sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpas gang bar gyur cing de rnams

translated: O children of the buddhas, if the buddhafields of the ten directions were as numerous as the atoms in an inexpressible number of inexpressible numbers of buddhafields and were filled with bodhisattvas who had attained this level and
